name: Jeremy McFall
text: Great people will use again if needed

resp.text: Thanks for your business and the rating.

name: BCS
text: Overall great experience. Great price great services

name: Pass Iton
text: Very professional and knowledgeable. Didn't know any one could repair video projectors. Repaired in 2 days. Thanks so much for your service. Our congregation thanks you as well.

name: Greg Hall
text: Couldn't ask for better experience.  I would give 1000 stars if it was possible.  I though TV's were just throw away now a days.  They gave me a free estimate, and was much better than replacing. Fixed in 2 days! Very knowledgeable, affordable, and timely.

name: Larry Hyvonen
text: Fixed my Denon receiver!!

resp.text: Thanks for your business and of course the rating.

name: Felicia Wise
text: Great work, cheap, and friendly service!

name: Stephen Letson
text: Fixed my TV...bad power supply. I took about 10 days to get the part, but once in fixed quick.

name: Bree The Nerd
text: A++ service. Friendly and helpful staff. Down to earth, locally owned shop. Highly recommend.

name: Gun Wench
text:
They won't let me give less than 1 star.
Sign says they open at 9 am.  Phone recording says they open at 9 AM.  No one around and doors locked at 9:10 AM.

resp.text: We are sorry for any inconvenience. There was a small situation where we were delayed a few minutes,  but the office was open by 9:10 AM.

name: Mikemike Fuqua
text:
You take product working and get product back not working.
This business  beat around the Bush when they done f××k up your product. Then come to found didnt even know what they were working on.  It funny how they  on the road when you want to pick your product after waiting for 4 months on it, but really at the shop the whole time half way putting your product back together .

resp.text: Sorry if your experience didn't meet you expectation.  However, every possible attempt was made to fix your unit.  The problem was related to a part that leaked on the PC board causing corrosion.  A part needed was on backorder from the Manufacture with no ETA.  The unit was reassembled completely before pickup.  Again we are sorry we couldn't work this out in a timely manner.

name: J G
text: My first visit today 10/18/18. I highly recommend this business for your repair work. I took it in on Monday evening and they had all back lights in 70” tv changed out and ready by Friday morning. Great work and very reasonable on cost of repairs. I very rarely ever leave reviews but that’s how I decided on this place and I at least owe them a review. Great job!!

name: gone blue enderman
text: THIS IS THE BEST!! I have never been to a place that has great customer service and great price!! I will use them every time!! 10 out of 10!!

name: raymond daniel
text: They do great work

name: Kenny Konig
text: I have a 3D TV. Many of you know how short in supply they are getting. I didn't know what to do when Lightening ran into the Cable Box and into the HDMI it was hooked to. Thats right threw the HDMI. I found this place. This Man never did give up on my TV. Only one board was found and it was bad. I had went on E-Bay so many times. Buying boards that half worked. He took my old Board and reworked it from the board we had to replace it and everything works. TVR thank you so very much for not giving up. He really knows his stuff and I would give him and the Repair shop a 10 Stars if I could. TVR is the best.

name: banyrooster69
text: This place is 🔥!! Josh was such a big help. He was personable, helpful and very knowledgeable. The service was quick and efficient. 10/10 would recommend to anyone needing to have their phone fixed.

name: Debbie Kline
text:
Pam at Trkcell in Mobile Alabama was amazing. She directed me here while visiting from Atlanta. I totaled my phone and she repaired it as well as fixed things I never thought would work again.
She’s professional, knowledgeable and just plain friendly.  This is the place to go for screen and phone maintenance!!!

name: Shahina Lakhani
text: Very knowledgeable staff and helped me with all the questions I had about my new phone.

name: Corinna “ReRe” Meyers
text: The young lady who helped me with my broken screen on my IPhone 6s Plus was very efficient! I had awesome service, she was very friendly and put much care into her work. I will definitely be back!

resp.text: Thanks a lot for the appreciation.

name: Teneille Grimes
text: I smashed my screen protector on the way out of town, I stopped by the mall to get a replacement. Josh was so sweet and helped tremendously. He helped me find a case that was very protective and found me a screen protector as well. I really appreciate your great customer service, Josh. Thank you!

name: Catherine Kloess
text: I love Cellairis and have used them twice previously. The cool part is that they protect the screen so that it doesn't break again with a cover that is not likely to break. This location is the exception. I just wanted to buy the screen over the phone and have it shipped so that I could travel only once to the store. This store is a bit of a journey for me.  They would not under any circumstance take a credit card over the phone and do this for the customer that is in Cellairis' customer data base. I am so visible on the internet. It makes me wonder if perhaps they had an employee who took customer information and used it for something nefarious. The idea that they could not take payment over the phone is odd in this day and age. I simply found them to be adversarial and not interested in one more customer. Every other Cellairis I have ever been to was completely amazing. If this is the worse thing that happens to me I will be just fine. I would not recommend this location to anyone and would advise you to consider what type of people own and operate a location that would behave this way.

resp.text:
Sorry for the experience Catherine,
However I would like to announce this to you that the ownership and management for this location has changed and we do accept online payments now.

name: Holly Lewis
text: Very sweet workers were very helpful. Shipment was fast and the call for repair was punctual! Great service

name: Sirissa Mason
text: Great service. Very nice young lady. Very helpful. I recommend

name: Brittany Knowles
text: Quick, same day service. Katrina Y. is very friendly, had service for screen repair and charger port in less than 30 minutes respectively. Cut a deal for repeat customers, also deals on accessories! Great repair service.

name: leslie luttrell
text: Very helpful and nice. Customer service was excellent and definitely will be going back. Thankyou

name: Freddie Malone
text: Dontayshia is very helpful. She fluently explained each case to me in detail and also answers every question that I had. Great cases, great energy, and great music. I surely look forward to purchasing with you all again in the future.

name: bden jesus (Bden)
text: I absolutely love this place! Got my phone smashed in an accident and came here looking for a repair and Shyna was so helpful and kind! She explained everything to me and made sure I was happy with the service. Definitely coming here for any more phone repairs in the future.

resp.text: Thanks a lot Berna :) I was a pleasure talking to you and your mom.

name: Richard Anderson
text: Pam was a awesome salesmen that provided everything I needed making me have the best experience.

name: Nazia Bano
text: Rachel is very sweet and informative. She has done my iPad and I am well pleased. I highly recommend her service if anyone need.

name: Steven Renner
text: Josh was the awesome. He hooked my screen protector up. If you’re looking for a quick transaction go to Bel Air Mall Cellairis & look for the tall guy.

name: Ashley Rivers
text: The guys at Cellairis are great! I got my shell shock screen protector and a case for a great deal! The customer service Ryan and Jordan provided was awesome. Thank you so much for your help!

name: AA 1KING
text: She was very nice and got me a beautiful case and I really love it

name: Carley Morris
text: I love these guys! I love the case I got from them and the glass screen protector! Ryan offered great customer service and helped me find just what I was looking for! I will definitely return! I couldn't be happier with the service I received!

name: Hartley Moorer
text: I always get the BEST customer service here! Dylan is awesome and super helpful! They do the repairs in a timely manner and have competitive prices!  HIGHLY recommend them!

name: Stephen Green
text: I had an absolute awesome experience with Cellairis. I had a shattered iPhone 6. It was fixed on the spot and I am really enjoying my privacy screen I bought for a very fair price. They had amazing customer service and Ryan helped me find everything I was looking for.

name: Parker Pledger
text: Awesome job! They were quick and not too expensive. The guys who did it were named Jordan and Ryan, I think. They got my screen fixed and sold me a screen protector.

name: William Kiker
text: Katrina did amazing. My phone was shot to hell and she fixed everything in it! She stayed over late just to make sure it was working perfectly. She went above and beyond. I will be coming back to her everytime from now on!!

name: Angelica Greene
text: Steve was very helpful, he was nice and very friendly. He was professional and answered all questions with no problem. Also my phone screen is beautiful ! Looks just as good as a new phone!

name: leonardo nava
text: Pam did a great service when I came to get a phone case

name: FDG Greatness
text: Dontaysha was great! She always has a great attitude and smile every time I come. Great customer service! Keep it up Cellairis!

name: Hunter Williamson
text: Awesome experience with Ryan at Cellairis! 10/10 would recommend! Ryan fixed my iPhone 6 within a matter of minutes!! I also got a great deal on my new case and glass screen protector! 👍🏼

name: Adria Clarke
text: Great attention to deal. Sale Representative takes pride in delivering great customer service. I will recommend his services to all my friends and family.

name: Tanaka Scott
text: Great service very nice PAM IS THE LADY TOO SEE!!

name: S Baker
text: I took my iPhone 6S in for them to repair a broken screen. The rep Dylan Hartung worked on my phone. When I Received my phone back it was missing screws, the phone kept turning on and off and the screen was raised up on the edge. When I returned he had an attitude so another rep offered attempted to repair the phone. Needless to say I had to return with my phone again on that Sunday and now my phone does not work at all. I have called the corporate office and sent emails and no one has attempted to contact me. Don't EVER take your phone there. The other 2 reps that attempted to help were very nice.

name: Jordan Harris
text: Got my phone fixed here and it only took an hour. Noelle is who fixed my phone and she was super nice and explained everything for me step by step. It was way cheaper than going to the Apple store!

name: Parker Pledger
text: Awesome job! They were quick and not too expensive. The guys who did it were named Jordan and Ryan, I think. They got my screen fixed and sold me a screen protector.

name: bre me
text:
TLDR: Shyna and Rachel are amazing at their jobs and fixing a bad day, and I definitely would (and will) come here again for other repairs. Also, their selection of cases is massive and full of variety. Call them about estimates and such.

3 hours ago, the phone I am typing this on wouldn't turn on and the screen was cracked badly after a very bad day. By the time I got off work, it was 7:45, and all other phone repair shops in town were closed. It's Veterans Day weekend which means a lot of places are closed for the next day or two. Thank god Cellairis was open. I called and asked for an estimate before going and asked about a student discount and screen protector. Shyna gave me an incredible deal for calling that made this struggling college student feel sooooooo much better. And when there was confusion between what Shyna told me on the phone and what I was told in one store (since there are two locations in the mall, Shyna's deal was honored!! One of the things they test for after fixing a phone wasn't met when I came to pick up my phone, and Shyna worked on my phone well past their closing hours and tested it until it met their standards. Rachel stayed to help out as well and make sure everything went well and I was satisfied. They both were very kind, and they both were so very helpful! They also talked to me like a normal person and explained what they were doing when I asked, and they were very friendly. It's been a while since I have had service that nice! Thank you both so much!

Brenna

name: Elizabeth Bolden
text: They are very friendly people. Andrew is the best person to get your phone equipment from. Dylan is very knowledgable about all phones and gives reasonable deals.

name: Sherry Bagley
text: Steve Austin helped me get a new phone cover an he couldn’t have been more professional an courteous. I felt very comfortable talking an asking questions. Class A.

name: Osheia Tucker
text: Tyler helped me out today. Awesome customer service and I got a cute case for my iPhone 8 Plus! Couldn’t be happier!

name: Jimmy Warren
text: I bought a 27 dollar tempered glass screen protector for my s8+ and the guy that put it on for me did a horrible job of cleaning my phone before he put the glass on. He didn't seem to care at all. Now i have to look at dust every time im on my phone. Thanks for nothing and the horrible customer service.

name: Helenea Bohannon
text: Steve and Tyler were the best. They were very helpful with my phone and did an outstanding job at fixing my screen and helped me pick out an awesome new case!!!

name: Renee Kendall
text: I recently had shattered my brand new iphone 6s and was devastated thinking that I wouldn't be able to get it fixed, or have to spend an unreasonable amount of money on the repair. I heard about Cellairis in the mall and stopped by to see how much it would be to fix my phone. I spoke with Dylan and he was extremely helpful and fantastic with the repair!! I decided to go ahead and let him work on it for me and he had it finished in no time at all! I am so thankful that my iphone is now back in awesome working condition, just like when I bought it! I loved the friendly and helpful service here and I would HIGHLY recommend this to anyone who has any phone repair and accessory needs. I will definitely be coming back!

name: Megan Newman
text: Steve and Tyler were of great help and very informative! Definitely go see them! Love my new case!

name: Bridgette Sullivan
text: Steve was very kind & professional. He prides himself in working as quickly & efficient possible. He will give u the best price possible. Need a screen fixed, a protector screen or a case he's ur guy!

name: Emily Thomas
text: I got a case and tempered glass screen protector from here and I love it! I love the wide selection of cases they offer! Great customer service, very nice and helpful guys working here! Would recommend to anyone needing a screen repair or new durable case.

name: Cynthia Ritter
text: Steve was fantastic. He had the case I was looking for and his professionalism was exceptional. My experience was awesome

name: Charlotte “Railynn” Reid
text: I got the best service here thank you

name: Gertrudis Hernandez
text: Great customer service. Guts know a lot about technology. I was out in 5 minutes.

name: B & B
text: Very great customer service. Very great variety!

name: Pearl Jeannine Massengill
text: Great service! Happy with merchandise! Great   Personality !

name: Paige Melton
text: Pam is has great customer service, she is really patient. I love her service

name: Debra Mumford
text: Dylan and Andrew are super nice. I appreciated the time and care they showed us while repairing my daughters phone.  I sincerely recommend Cellairis for all your phone repairs.

name: Artedra Williams
text: Pam she was great she offered great service and I will be coming back the next time I have a problem

name: Meggan Shanee
text: Pam was very sweet helped me tremendously!

name: Marissa McMillan
text: Absolutely amazing service! Great place for accessories and repairs. Fantastic 5 starts for Tyler and Cellairis.

name: Romeo Rodriguez
text:
I took my phone to get the battery/speaker  changed. They weren’t able to fix the speaker. But my volume wasn’t working after words.
And instead go fixing it the wanted me to do all new paper work to check my volume. So now my battery is fine but volume doesn’t work. I will never  take my phone there again

name: Sherry Bagley
text: Steve Austin helped me get a new phone cover an he couldn’t have been more professional an courteous. I felt very comfortable talking an asking questions. Class A.

name: Brittni Trawick
text:
Love the case. And loved the customer service I recieved over the phone from the HOME company.

I stopped by the store today to purchase my second phone case with the bundle and the person tried to charge me $100. I knew it was over priced, but the person working continued to tell me the manager said it was $100.

I called customer service only to find out if the prices online included the bundle, which they did. Turns out the kiosk tried to charge me double of what the actual price was. Very frustrated with the kiosk, but glad the HOME office assured me I was being over priced.

resp.text:
Hi Brittni,
This is Shahina. I believe we were able to take care of you and you left satisfied from the store during your second visit. Please let me know if theres anything else we can do to improve the experience.

name: Osheia Tucker
text: Tyler helped me out today. Awesome customer service and I got a cute case for my iPhone 8 Plus! Couldn’t be happier!

name: GH_PLC One
text: Quick and efficient. Great people to work with.

name: David Merriam
text: Top notch screen replacement done by Andrew in 15 min! Both guys were very personable, professional and helpful! I will give them my business again soon!

name: Jordan Harris
text: Got my phone fixed here and it only took an hour. Noelle is who fixed my phone and she was super nice and explained everything for me step by step. It was way cheaper than going to the Apple store!

name: Jemela Jeffery
text: Great customer service. Tyler and Keil were wonderful in helping me with what I needed. I will definitely return to shop with them again.

name: Shakeyta Timmons
text: Very nice people has great customer service

name: Kayla Dickson
text: The sweetest and most helpful people ever!

name: Jaishon Robinson
text: This place fixed my phone very quickly and also had some great customer service!

name: Wanda Sullivan
text: My daughter's phone had a shattered screen and bad battery. Steve replaced the screen and even stayed after closing! The next day I brought it back and Keil replaced the battery and gave me a generous discount because it was my second repair with them. They were both extremely nice! I highly recommend and will go back if anything else goes wrong with our phones!

name: Kara Bexley
text: Keil made my shopping experience so convenient. He has a positive attitude that is contagious!!!! Thanks for fixing my phone in like 10 min.

name: Hmj. Ant
text: A very great and helpful company with great costumer  service

name: John Haddish
text: Gerald was very helpful and gave detailed information on the phone cases. If you would like great service come here.

name: Abigail Foster
text: The customer service was great and it didn’t take long at all.

name: John Pennant
text: I had an iPhone X that had screen issues and also Face ID issues and the people at cellairis worked relentlessly to troubleshoot and repair the issue, I’d personally recommend cellairis over Apple in all honesty. Thanks again !

name: Ty Singletary
text:
Tuesday, May 24 I took my shattered iPhone 6 to one of your locations in Bel Air Mall to be serviced. Specifically, I was at the kiosk located across from Victoria's Secret, and Ryan was working. He did an excellent job replacing my phone screen as well as talking with me throughout the process while we established mutual connections and potential endeavors. Even when I discovered a small issue after I left the mall, Ryan made every effort to rectify the problem. The issue with the phone was pre-existing, but he treated it as if it had happened in-store as he diligently worked to get my phone back to normal in the quickest possible time. Ryan made an inauspicious event turn into a pleasurable experience.

If you have any malfunctions with your phone or need a new case, Cellairis should be the first place you go.

I decided to go ahead and let him work on it for me and he had it finished in no time at all! I am so thankful that my iphone is now back in awesome working condition, just like when I bought it! name: bre me
text:
TLDR: Shyna and Rachel are amazing at their jobs and fixing a bad day, and I definitely would (and will) come here again for other repairs. Also, their selection of cases is massive and full of variety. Call them about estimates and such.

3 hours ago, the phone I am typing this on wouldn't turn on and the screen was cracked badly after a very bad day. By the time I got off work, it was 7:45, and all other phone repair shops in town were closed. It's Veterans Day weekend which means a lot of places are closed for the next day or two. Thank god Cellairis was open. I called and asked for an estimate before going and asked about a student discount and screen protector. Shyna gave me an incredible deal for calling that made this struggling college student feel sooooooo much better. And when there was confusion between what Shyna told me on the phone and what I was told in one store (since there are two locations in the mall, Shyna's deal was honored!! One of the things they test for after fixing a phone wasn't met when I came to pick up my phone, and Shyna worked on my phone well past their closing hours and tested it until it met their standards. Rachel stayed to help out as well and make sure everything went well and I was satisfied. They both were very kind, and they both were so very helpful! They also talked to me like a normal person and explained what they were doing when I asked, and they were very friendly. It's been a while since I have had service that nice! Thank you both so much!

Brenna

Tl;dr- don't go here. terrible service and repair would not recommend this place if hitler were holding my family in a gas chamber.

This place used to be called In and Out Smart Repair and offered the exact same service. I signed up for a monthly subscription. They've since changed name or ownership. I still get a recurring charge from In and Out under that name, and both the email and phone number listed in the email are not in service so I have no way or canceling the account.

I called this location last month to ask and the person on the phone told me he canceled it right then and there. Today I got charged again for In and Out.

I needed a phone in order to be safe at Gulf Shores and they have amazing prices and are so fast and easy. Very productive with no contracts and no complications. name: Abby Benson
text: I took my phone here for a simple screen replacement.  Shortly after leaving I notice my home button, Touch ID and camera were not working all of which were previously working when I dropped it off. I called and they told me to bring the phone back in and they would fix it.  I took the phone back today and the employee told me he couldn’t fix it. He offered to refund my money which I was appreciative of. He then proceeded to put the old screen back on the phone and now the entire phone won’t work.  The only thing it will do is display an apple logo. I told the guy- and he apologized, but offered no assistance in getting the phone to the working conditions that I dropped it off in.  This phone is less than 4months old.

name: Evita B
text:
My husband cracked the screen of my Note 8 by accident and I didn't want to replace it. Found this place and decided to give it a try. They had to order my screen and we paid in advance. Asked about insurance, which we don't have on my phone because I've never broken any of my phones. The guy at the counter kept commenting on how expensive it was going to be.... okay, so?... I want my phone fixed and your business does this right...?

We paid and were told it would take 3 to 5 days for the screen to come in; they would call me and I could come in and have the phone's screen replaced in an hour or so. 10 days pass and no one calls me. My husband calls them and they say the screen is in and I can come in and get it replaced. They then try to call me, but I was unavailable. The next day, he drops the phone off as soon as they open at 10am, and was informed that the only one who could fix it wasn't there yet. He would be there in 45mins and it would take 2hrs to fix the screen. 2 hrs....

My husband decided to go to the gym, then come home and clean up. He called them at 2pm and my phone was still being worked on: they said give him more time. He arrived there after 3:30pm and the phone was not finished being repaired. Decided to pick up dinner next door. Still not done. So finally, around 4pm it is finished. It works and has a lifetime warranty for the pressure sensitivity. This was one thing I was concerned about: the screen's pressure sensitivity.

I get my phone and inspect it. It was not even sealed properly! Therefore, it is not waterproof anymore, and not resellable. Annoyed, I go to the shop myself and the tech who worked on my phone is very apologetic, admits it was done incorrectly, but is unable to help me. He said he was busy and trying to hurry because my husband had been waiting for a while. Still has a lot of things to work on; I could leave it overnight, come by tomorrow. Maybe it would get done. I can't leave my phone there overnight, and I can't come back the next day. He was going to try and put weight on the phone before taking the screen off and resealing it.

That is what I'm trying to do now: put weight on it. I wrapped it in screen cleaning cloths and set a gallon water jug on it. About 7 or 8 lbs. I asked him how much weight, but he never answered me, telling me instead about the warranty. The warranty is for the screen's pressure sensitivity.

I'd rather have it take a long time and done correctly, than rushed and crappy. Now, I'm trying to correctly their mistake. I don't think pressing it down with weight will help. It is misaligned somewhere, and not glued and seal properly.

Paid $340 to have my phone's screen replaced and they didn't do it properly. The back part is spongy; you press down and it comes back up. The whole left side was not placed correctly or glued down properly. Would never go here again. And would urge everyone to not waste their time until the people at CPR have better organization and attention to detail. They also seem like they need more knowledgeable people. My husband was told this tech had never worked on a Samsung Note 8 and that one of them only works on computers and laptops; no phones at all. Cell Phone Repair.

resp.text: It sounds like you love the Note 8 and we do too. Please return the device to the store so we can help out.

name: Kyle H
text: I went in trying to get my charging port repaired and was told they would have to destroy the screen and the repair would be over $200. I was advised instead to purchase a wireless charger elsewhere and a battery from them since mine was weak. I did buy the battery from them and they came from the back with a battery that had no seal or package and sold it to me for $40 and took my old battery, which it would not charge past 20% until I bought a new battery from another location indicating they sold me a used battery as new. What they didn't inform me was that my phone was not wireless charging capable. I went back to try and get a refund but I was never given a receipt and they said they can't do anything about it since they have no records of them selling it to me. Not only am I now stuck with a used battery that was sold as a new but was given false information. I took my business to another phone repair shop that was capable of performing my repair at $65 compared to their quoted $200 and my screen never had to be shattered. I advise not conducting any business with this store if you need anything because you may end up with used parts and misleading information.

resp.text:
Hi Kyle, I wish you would have contacted us directly regarding this. We would have been happy to explain why this is the way that it is.

The repair shop that you brought your device to has the capability of micro soldering a new charging port to the existing cable. We do not have that capability which means that we must remove the entire flex cable to change the port. The problem with that is the navigation buttons that are on the phone are sealed under the screen and wrap around to the charge port. Meaning for us to get those out we must lift the screen after heating it substantially. It’s very risky and leads to cracked LCDs in most cases.

We NEVER want to take advantage of anyone. We set expectations for everything. We would rather you know the entire truth before going with our service.

Now, to the battery. We buy batteries in bulk which do not come in “retail” packaging. We would have gladly given you a full refund on that item if it was not working up to our standards.

As you can see from most of our reviews, we go above and beyond for our customers. A $40 battery would not be worth losing a customer over.

I will still gladly refund the $40 if you come in and ask for Jessie.

As I appreciate the feedback I believe a 1 star review isn’t warranted in this case. We just lack the capabilities in making that specific repair cheaper.

The reality is the explanation you were given is 100% accurate because we would need to replace the screen as well which cost well over $100 just to get it to our shop.

I am happy that you were able to get it fixed elsewhere and for cheaper. We cannot speak to other repair shops capabilities, only our own.

Thanks for your consideration and please come see us for your refund.

Jessie

name: Erica McElhaney
text: Recommend.  They worked really hard to fix my very broken phone!  I appreciate that they really gave it 100% effort!

name: Jennifer Skeel
text: AT&T recommended In and Out Repair.  My phone was in a restart loop and I had tried several things to no avail. Joel and his crew had my phone working in 2 hours!!!!  I highly recommend them to anyone having phone issues!!!!

I really would like my tablet and the $200 I have paid back. I don’t know who to talk to. Customer service is not returning calls. SO frustrated!

I dont understand. Thats why im giving them 1 star, when issue is fixed ill gladly change my rating but 1star for now.

name: Brianna Kilow
text: I cracked and destroyed my Apple Watch and called over to this business asking for pricing. I spoke with a guy name Duncan(maybe not his name, not sure) and he gave me a price and told me it would take 5 DAYS for it to be fixed and returned back to me. I dropped my watch off on April 16th almost at closing time. It is April 30th and I still have not received my watch. I’ve called multiple times to check the status and every time they tell me it will be back in a couple of days. I called Monday and I was told he received tracking and that it’ll be here in a couple of days. I sent a friend to the place of business to get a status update and my friend was told that it shipped today ( April 30th) and will be here in a few days. So I called back up there and talked to the same guy and he told me that they received tracking information Monday but it didn’t ship until today (BS). I also made him aware that my last day in the area would be Sunday and I will need my watch before I leave, he says if it’s not here by Sunday we can ship it to you ( which I’m sure will be another week). At this point I asked to speak to the manager, he said he wasn’t in but he would call him to see if they could expedite my watch ( how do you expedite a shipment that has already been shipped) and he would get back in touch with. Oh he also mentioned that the reason why it’s taking so long is because the person they sent the watches to is backed up with orders and his shop has been closed and I said why wasn’t I told this from the beginning, I was told 5 days and he said he didn’t know that information until after my watch shipped. So yea, no watch still and it still isn’t promised to be here before I leave town. Worse experience EVER. OH NOT TO MENTION THIS IS COSTING ME $258.

resp.text: Brianna please accept our apologies on the delays in meeting those original time frames   We have seen a fast increase is Apple Watch Repair’s and working with our partners to insure delays are cut down to a minimum going forward we strive to get every device in and out in the fastest possible time . Communication is key and along with the partners we use are working on a ticketing system that will offer status update along the way we greatly appreciate your business and if there is anything you ever need please don’t hesitate to call or stop in! Stay safe and well

name: Blake Bedsole
text: Took my mother to get a new phone today as she busted her old one (motherboard and all) not really fixable; however, after getting a new phone (through a phone company) and being told the phone she picked has no screen protectors available, I quickly messaged ifixandrepair Walmart location, in hopes they would have something. Within two minutes I received a response with the product I requested and the price. Met with Tyler as I came into the store explaining we were on the search for screen protectors for which he showed us all available options and what they would look like once installed. Needless to say not only did my mom get one but so did I and we are both very pleased. I recommend anyone with phone repairs or just on the look for new accessories or gadgets visit Tyler and his team for prompt and quality service!

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your kind words, Blake. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us — and we agree, Tyler is truly a gem to have on our team! We count ourselves lucky for customers like you. We look forward to working with you again in the future!

Please follow us on Facebook @ifardothan.

Have a lovely day!

name: Kayden Chapel
text:
I was out of town and my phone crashed on me. I went in to get it fixed and they said it would be a week and they would ship it to me. After 35 days and tons of phone calls to the owner my phone could not be located and all of them were caught in multiple lies. If that wasn’t bad enough they stopped answering my calls so I was left without a phone. After a month and a half I finally got my phone back and there were even more problems than when I gave it to them. NEVER TAKE YOUR PHONE HERE. The owner Tyler lied to my face and wouldn’t even give me my phone back when I asked for it 6 hours after I left it. I have never dealt with so many dishonest people at one store. Worst experience of my life. The experience was horrible, and to make it worse I got took for $200 and they refused to refund after not fixing the problems and causing more.

Response 2: I guess the “board repair time frame” covers all the lies told. Also once again another lie. Ifixit denied the charges being refunded and the credit card company had to eat them.

resp.text:
Unfortunately. The board repair time frame was out of our control . As a third party board repair team is the ones we use . While having it at board repair a charge back was placed on the payment and was sent back to you as soon as we had it back in our position . This was also handled at the end of last year as we have the charge back notice  as it was never our desire for the time frame we updated you based on the information provided by the boated repair team

Some iPhone 7 devices have many many  board level and chip level flaws that are design issues and also beyond anything that can be controlled or prevented

name: Mary T
text:
DO NOT USE THIS PLACE!!!

Took in my Galaxy S7 Edge after I dropped it and screen turned green and flickered. Everything else was working great, including charging.

Was told it needed new screen. Paid $230 with my debit card and was then informed that there would be no warranty. Got an email receipt.

Got my phone back a few days later and it was down to 1%. So I immediately tried to charge it and got an error message that the battery temp was too low to charge.

Went in the next morning and was told it needed a new battery because old battery would not charge new LED screen (which I should have been told on first visit). Paid $60 MORE. Also told there was no tax since I paid with cash and was not offered a receipt nor one by email (like previous time).

My husband picks the phone up, tries to charge it and gets the SAME error message.

He calls them and is now told that the motherboard is probably bad and it needs a new one. NO FLIPPING WAY was I giving them another dime!!

I am out almost $300 and STILL have no phone to use!!!

They basically  just took my money and did not fix my phone.

I DO NOT recommend this place AT ALL and will be contacting BBB!

resp.text: Mam, I'm sorry that the repair did not work out to your satisfaction. We did everything in our power to help you with your phone. And provided you with every option at our disposal. And we did everything that we could over the phone to explain to you the error that your phone was still having from both me and my assistant. Unfortunately sometimes when performing a repair, be it on a car a house or an electronic device there is more wrong with it than just the issue that you drop it off for. These issues are unfortunate, nonetheless, but sometimes they are there. I apologize you're unsatisfied, and if you change your mind and decide to get the device fixed as we said on the phone, the amount that you have already paid for the battery repair will apply towards the motherboard. I hope you have a great day and if you need anything else give us a call!!

name: Kim McConnon
text: Best place around! Easy to get affordable phone repairs! Much appreciated! They are knowledgeable and make it stress free

name: Blair McAbee
text:
Although my phone was repaired, I will not recomend them. I do not trust businesses that ask for payment up front and then tell you they have a no refund policy if their service comes into question. Just because you call something a store policy, does not make it legally or morally correct.
I award this business a negative one star rating.

resp.text: Glad that your phone works! I cannot find a ticket for repair with your info on it ... Nonetheless, the business policies that we've developed over the years are a direct reflection on experiences we've had in the past. And I assure you in this industry they are very commonplace. The parts that we use do carry a warranty. Again glad to hear that your phone's doing well, you need anything please let us know!

I’m a senior at high risk for Covid and would appreciate if the staff would take that into consideration to protect all their customers, not just seniors.  I came to the store at the recommendation of another senior.  We all need to do our part to end this pandemic and save lives.

name: Brandon Ritchey
text: Was quoted one price, called the next day and was told it would be an extra $20 for overnight shipping even though the day before was told it would also arrive the next day for repair. Ended up taking over a week to come in and so when I dropped it off I requested the extra fee be refunded. Guy took an attitude about it but agreed. When I picked it up the next day I asked if it had been refunded. The woman told me I was ridiculous and just handed me a $20 bill Extremely unprofessional.

resp.text:
Hi Brandon!!!
We did order your part for overnight delivery, unfortunately due to an error in FedEx system we did not receive it overnight. I do remember the conversation with you and did agree that it would be no issue to refund you the overnight shipping. We received the part and had it in your hands today as well as the refund. and after watching the tape I couldn't find a single instance where my employee called you ridiculous. But nonetheless, I apologize that you had an unpleasant experience and we look forward to helping you next time should the need arise. Have a great day!!

resp.text: We are closed on Saturday....our door has the hours as well as Google. Sorry for the confusion.we are doing our best to help all in these trying times.

name: Carla BOYD
text: Just left cell Repairs +. Had a great experience Got my battery replaced in my iPhone I was in and out in about 20 minutes great bunch of people didn’t try to sell me what I didn’t need I’m very well pleased!! I will be recommending cell repair + to my friends thanks so much Jon !!!

name: Blake nobles
text: I had a great experience,great customer service. This store was the only store to have my parts in stock. They had my phone fixed in 20 mins and they were the cheapest. I highly recommend CELL REPAIRS PLUS

name: Harper Lee
text:
Total scam. First you pay 40 dollars to get the phone evaluated which was not explained from the start, then another hundred for a potential repair not a guaranteed repair mind you! I should have just got a replacement from my phone company for a hundred. I was trying to get my contacts. What a waste of forty dollars time  and potentially wasting a total of
140 dollars with no guarantee! He must pay for reviews as he is not credible or honest! Unbelievable, he is still in business! Don’t trust anything he says or states! Go elsewhere,  anywhere but there! Trust me there are far more reputable honest folks that charge the right amount to start and either can or can not do the repair.

I am reporting him to better business bureau for his deception and dishonesty.

resp.text:
Miss Lee we wish you the best as we did on the phone the other day. We charge 40 $ to diagnose any device that comes in unresponsive, to cover our costs  and then apply that money towards the total cost of the repair if the customer chooses to do so. We explain that without fail every time we do a diagnostic. I apologize for any misunderstanding that you had with us in our initial conversation.

We take the word guarantee very seriously, and would never guarantee repair on a phone we haven't seen in months. That Miss Lee and that alone is why would not guarantee a repair. We do guarantee our repairs and most of all parts have a lifetime warranty. I'm sorry that you felt that this review was necessary as well as  the conversation and language you used with us on the phone the other day was necessary but we do sincerely wish you the best.

JF

text: I decided to go to PC Tech due to the positive feedback I saw on google reviews. I had an issue with my computer charge port so I dropped it off to get it diagnosed for repair. I was later told it was the DC jack needing replaced and the repair would cost 150.00. I was blown away at the price so I decided to think on it. Shawn told me the part alone cost 50 dollars. I told him I would rather look around for another computer and I would like to pick up my computer. He told me come on by and pick it up the following day. A few days later I decided to pull it apart and see how detailed the work was. As I took it apart I noticed there was no hard drive in it. I called Shawn as he proceeded to say that that happens sometimes and his kid must have forgot to put it back in when they were looking for the issue. Additionally I found the part on eBay new for less than 20 dolllars. Not to mention the fact that the diagnoses when they originally took it apart would have been an extra screw to replace the DC jack which he tried charging me another 100 bucks. All together a very bad experience and I would rather avoid this place at all cost.

name: Jason Smith
text: Jay was super kind and informative when it came to my repair on my iphone 7plus. She was not annoyed by any of my million questions, and even allowed me to pull up a chair and watch the whole repair for myself. She warned me of all the potential issues that are common with my phone but assured me they were not that common. She had a steady hand and was able to talk to me with ease while working with such tiny screws and parts. She is a miracle worker and it only took her exactly 18 mins! I don't know what she is being paid but whatever it is I know this girl deserves a raise! Awesome customer service! I would give 10 stars if I could! Highly recommended, but be sure to ask for Jay!

I called Apple and they said they could fix it and indeed did fix it after I paid this horrrible company to fix it. Their prices are only 5 dollars cheaper that Apple. So if I was you go to Apple and fix it. They charged me 275 Apple charged me 280 and fixed it in one week. It took this place 3 and a half weeks to figure out that they didn’t know why they were doing. The lies. The time without the phone, the mismanagement of my device and the owner DAVID FAILS needs to reevaluate his processes. His employees do not know what they are doing....my experience sucked with them and I hope everyone uses another route to get there phone fixed.

text: They advertise theyre open when the mall is open but when my daughter and i got there to get her iphone x fixed last week the lights were off at 8:05pm. We decided to try the nice people by the food court and got excelent service at a great price. We were walking around the mall shopping and noticed the little sales associate who helped us spencers went into cellairis kiosk to do things on the computer. When my daughter asked if she worked there the girl smiled and said she works both places sometimes. Thats terrible buisness. According to the neighbors arou d this so call buisness they do this alot. You need people who are actually going to stay and work and focus on our phones and not be working 2 jobs at once! I recommend going to celebration in the mall by the food court. Super nice, knowledgeable, and they put 100% focus on you and your repair only.

resp.text: James, thank you for your honest review. Our employee that was supposed to be at work got sick, had to leave and we did not have anyone available to come in on short notice. The young lady you spoke to that works at Spencer's is a part time employee and was working at Spencer's but stepped over during her break to close out the day for us. You will also notice that we have a 4.7 star review with over 200 customers contributing. I do hope you give us another chance.

name: Cliff Carlisle
text:
Eastdale Mall/ Montgomery, AL

DONT DO IT!! Horrible customer service. Terrible products (their brand) Good luck getting in touch with the manager. The reviews here must be from employees.

I had a screen break. They fixed it. Took an incredibly long time. I walked around for a little while and the guy who started fixing my phone was texting his fingers off until I interrupted him to ask if he was done with my phone (Of course not). After getting my phone back and insisting on an Otter Box the employee (Ferris) convinced me that the glass screen protector he had could break, BUT IT WOULD SAVE THE PHONE'S SCREEN. He even showed me where it saved the store's IPad. Having a thinner phone than with the Otter Box had its appeals, I even bought a minimal case to be extra sure. After a week of babying my phone, I made the mistake of bending over with it in my front pocket (3ish ft fall). Glass protector and the screen shattered. I was pretty pissed.

Went back to the store. New girl (Magen) seemed a little overwhelmed with helping other people so I was relatively nice to her. She told me that Ferris was promoted to manage his own store (watch out).I told her the story and asked for a refund of the defective glass screen and plastic case (both failed at doing their job and cost me another screen). She refused because she didn't have the authority. I asked to speak to the manager and she called him from her cell phone and walked outside (abandoned kiosk in the eastdale mall could have been costly) left me there and came back. Nope, the manager wouldn't do anything either, and I wasn't allowed to speak to him (STORE POLICY!!!!) She cut $10 off the new glass screen and gave me the managers email address.

I am only writing this after attempting to contact the manager for the past two weeks(Chris Vick) I'm normally not the kind of guy that would do this. However, this business has terrible products that promote future phone screen replacements (kind of brilliant), have terrible customer service and even worse management.

$400 taught me a valuable lesson about Cellairis...If I ever break my phone again, Ill support the Arabs a few kiosks down.

name: cowabunga bartholamew
text: Fast and friendly service! Mark looked at my Surface Pro..told me what needed to happen, how much it would cost and how long it would take. However, after working on it for 30 minutes he called and said I had additional problems. He assured me he would do everything possible to correct the issue. Almost to the minute he called and said it was ready. I was prepared to pay the extra time he had to spend on it but he didn't charge a dime extra and also fixed the unexpected! I would recommend them for all your cell and pc problems. Knowledgeable and professional!

name: Kim Mayton
text: Recently stopped in to see if the phone my son was using could be fixed. It could have been fixed but there was no guarantee it would still work due to the condition. That is because after it fell from my son’s pocket over our back fence, he decided to use an ax to cut the overgrown stuff without being able to see under the area. Yep, you can guess he destroyed the phone with the ax & possibly stepping on it. The phone did have tempered glass & an Otterbox Defender case on it at the time. The tempered glass on my phone had a bit of an air bubble in it & it was replaced for me with one that fit my phone a bit better. 😊

name: Edward Vance
text:
This is definitely the place I will be getting any repairs done on my cell phone. The first time they were able to help me was a few years ago. I dropped my phone and the screen was busted. I was able to leave it with them and have the repairs made. They paid the shipping, had it delivered because of my hectic work schedule. So that was definitely a huge plus.
Today I was finally able to get in to have them look at my phone. Something was shaking around in the phone and it was driving me crazy.   They were able to open the phone up and put the correct adhesive on the battery which corrected the issue. They closed my phone up properly and I was on my way. Thankful to have a quality repair facility to take my phone to if it gives me trouble.

If I could give a second google review for this shop I would, and also give it another 5 star review! Since i can't leave 2 reviews, I thought I would edit the original and add on my experience. About a week ago I realized my phone screen that was already cracked, spread all across it, and it became unbearable to use. I googled and called the cell pro, they ordered me a replacement screen and I came in last Saturday to have it installed. Jason, had it swapped out before I could grab lunch and come back to pick it up. Later that day I notice that my screen unlock button wasnt unlocking my phone, all the time and I later realized that it was and just not getting bright enough. I called the store, wrote an email to the one they send you a receipt and notifications of your repair on, and messaged the Facebook page for the store. Late at night someone I assume to be the owner messaged me back on Facebook. Made arrangements for someone to come on Sunday to work around my schedule to check out the phone. Sunday came and I went to the store, Jason checked out my phone again did some things to it, and told me to keep an eye on it, bring it back if theres still trouble. Today Monday May 3rd 2021 I went back an explained to another employee that I realized it was unlocking it just not getting brighter. He offered to order another replacement screen and replace it, and mentioned it could be something else like a graphics card or other internals going bad. (I bought this phone in 2016) To my suprise after asking if they would consider returning my money for the screen and replacing the old screen into the phone, they did. With no questions asked. I figured it was time to chop off the thumb to save the hand and put that money towards a new phone.

These guys are not out to make a quick buck or rip anyone off, they have bent over backwards to help me twice, on two separate occasions. I greatly thank them for it. While I did lose the 45 dollar installation fee for the new screen (after I decided that's what I wanted), they worked on it three times and gave me my money back. While my phone is still messed up, it is just as messed up as before these guys helped me and it is at no fault to them.  While I hope I never need to repair any electronics they service, I know exactly where I will go if i ever need to. All things considered I'm extremely satisfied!

text: This place is the most unprofessional place in Montgomery there lack of knowledge is astronomical took my wife's phone in for repair charged me 90.00 now it wont work and they cant fix it I would advise any body looking to get a cellphone fixed STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE

resp.text: Good afternoon Mr. Osborn, my name is Jason and I am the Senior Technician for The Cell Pro LLC. I am sorry to read that your expectations for your phone and the end results were not a closer match. After speaking to the technician and reviewing our records, they suggest that the device came in with the complaint and visual indications that the device had experienced an extreme fall. This incident resulted in the severe damage to both the front lcd/digitizer, middle frame, as well as the back battery door or rear housing. Unfortunately devices that have that severe of damage, even after minor repair such as a screen change, can still have additional problems that are not detectable until after interaction with the device can be achieved. Your above review is not entirely accurate as you stated "now it wont work and they cant fix it". The device does work and you are able to interact with the device through the new lcd/digitizer and the battery door has been replaced, as you requested. If you were to take your car in to have a new front and rear windshield replaced, then afterward, state that the transmission doesn't work as a result of replacing the windshields, well, that is not a logical conclusion. In your case of "now it wont work and they cant fix it", means that the device does work but will not make a phone call. Screen changes and battery door replacements only require a very minimum amount of heat being applied to the device in order to loosen the adhesives. This is very unlikely to cause any damage to the hardware that would relate to the devices' ability to connect to a carrier's network. However, in our efforts to ensure that every customer is satisfied that their device was repaired properly or that every practical effort was attempted to repair that device, I will be happy to meet you and attempt to diagnose the problem that may be causing your additional issue. While I can't say the device will be able to be repaired, I will give it my best efforts. Again I am sorry that your expectations were not met under the circumstances, but look forward to the opportunity to further assist you.

name: Drews
text:
DO NOT TRUST THEM FOR BATTERY REPLACEMENTS ON IPHONES.

About a month ago, I got a battery replacement from them on my iphone, and the new one they put in was running out of battery even more than the old one--about 1% per minute--dying at 24%. So, I ran a battery testing app on it, and the replacement they installed performed WORSE than the original battery that was being replaced (the original was over 2 years old!)

So I brought it back to tell the owner, and he had the nerve to put a second garbage battery in my phone. Luckily, I looked at the battery as he was putting it in, and I saw that this "NEW" battery had the serial number literally covered up, with a black marker. I asked him why it was like that, and he stuttered and basically said nothing.

I got my money back and ordered a do-it-yourself kit from amazon, and what do ya know, the battery works great and performs really well on my testing app. These guys are scam artists and they get away with it because most people would never think to act that way.

Be very careful here, or go somewhere else.

resp.text:
Dear Zachary. Sorry for bad experience. We searched in our database we could not find any records.

Could you pls contact us at 205 887 5151

We will be happy to assist you and provide you with new Oem battery. We have warranty with every item we sell. We can contact our vendor to see what is the problem.

Note that sometimes motherboard drains battery dues to shorted caps or diodes.

We will be glad to do free diagnostic.

Please make sure this is the right location, we are located at

111 east magnolia avenue auburn al

name: Maria McBryde
text: Horrible customer service. They said they ordered a screen to repair my broken one, but on the day the screen was to arrive, they had absolutely no record of the location of the screen or even if it had been ordered. They then said it would take one more day, and when I asked the next day, they said three more days. It's been a week of "just a few more days" and still no screen. Steven M, their technician, cannot tell the location of the screen, or even if it has been ordered (even though he supposedly placed the order). Steven doesn't seem terribly concerned about checking the status until I show up in front of him. There is no response to my texts and certainly no pro-active checking on his part. Today I decided that if they cannot even tell whether a part has been ordered or where it is, then they certainly cannot be trusted to actually perform a repair. On top of that, I just realized looking at the receipt that they have listed the wrong model for my phone! I would not recommend this company at all.

resp.text:
Hello Maria,

Please allow me to apologize for the negative experiences you have encountered with our Harbert location. It is never our intention to misquote a repair time, and I am very sorry that we have fallen short of your expectations. If there is anything that we can do to improve your experience with us, our Customer Support team would love to know! At your earliest convenience, please reach out to them at (877)320-2237 Monday through Saturday 10AM to 10PM and Sunday 12PM to 8PM EST. Thank you and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: SaintMegery15
text: So, walked in and was promptly greeted. Explained that I needed my screen replaced on my iPhone. I take it out to show the guy and he presses all over it, and while he is telling me my battery is swollen and causing the screen to bend, he turns it on and my screen was split in half! I couldn't use half my screen! I work 2 blocks away and have been very careful with my phone (have had a bent-ish screen for months!) so I really don't think this happened in my pocket. I called him out on it as soon as I saw the screen and he said "Look, you can't even use the screen now". He proceeded to talk about other things with my phone and didn't address the problem of him breaking my screen. He priced a screen and battery for me, but I declined and walked out because he broke my screen and absolutely refused to acknowledge it. I went back to the office, called this place and asked to speak to the manager. He asked what was wrong and I told him about the staff breaking my screen. He reveals that the guy I'm speaking with on the phone is the one who "helped" me in the store, and said that he is the manager and owned the store. I calmly explained to him what he did and how I watched him do it right in front of my face. He REFUSED to take responsibility and tried offering a $10 discount for both screen and battery instead. I said no thanks, and to have a nice day before hanging up. I am SO upset - I ended up just buying a new phone since it was about the same cost of what he would charge for a screen and battery. Find someone honest and who knows what they are doing to fix your cell phone - not here!

resp.text: Megan we’re sorry you had a bad experience with us and we do remember your issue. You came in with a swollen battery and an already cracked screen. The phone was off when you came in and we turned it on to a discolored lcd. You came in with a cracked screen and swollen battery and left with a cracked screen and swollen battery even after giving you a special repair price due to the repair being more than one issue and you mentioned working near by as we do like to be extra friendly with our neighbors and business close to our locations. The price you were given is a price no other repair store would give and if they did we would match but in all we’re sorry for any inconvenience you may have had coming to our store and would like to mention that the special price quote still stands if you wish to stop by. Thank you and have a great day!

text: This place uses poor quality screens. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place. Got my iPhone screen replaced a few month ago. Immediately had to ask for a replacement since the screen was sticking out of the phone in the top right corner and flickering like crazy. When I went back they charged be extra and "replaced" it with and "original" apple screen. 1 month later the screen stopped working completely and the corner that stuck out and flickers cracked from the pressure without any impact. I went back again and had to argue since they wanted to charge me to replace the defect screen. Eventually they replaced it for free. After a few weeks  the new screen started to malfunction, AGAIN. This time the touch input is not working correctly. He further refuses to replace or refund the screen. Avoid this place and go somewhere else, it will safe time and money.

text:
I took a chromebook into UAB Phone Clinic. I asked the owner if he could
tell me why the charger would not go in the charging port. He took the chromebook to the back and came it 5 minutes later and said that he replaced the charging port and I owed him $70. A few days later ( 8 days )
later I cannot put the charger in the charging port. I called UAB clinic and a man said answered and said they were closing for the day and I could come in on Monday. I really needed to use the computer so I took it to another repair shop and told them that I just had the charging port replaced and I couldn't figure out what was wrong. UAB Phone Clinic had not repaired the charging port. The original port was still in the computer.
Evidently the man at UAB just straightened out the pins and charged me for a new charging port. Be very careful in UAB Phone Clinic. I wish I would have read through the reviews. I noticed that there were 5 stars but didn't take the time to read through them. I have talked to several people that have had bad experiences with this place but didn't take the time to
do a review.

resp.text:
Hey Richard,

Sorry to hear that. In fact we provide 6 month warranty for screens we install. And most of the time customers praise our quality.

We would like to help with this problem and if it is dues to manifacturer error we will give you a free screen.

Our outer screen grade is OEM even for premium aftermarket parts.

Problem might be dues to installation error or something but hard to tell before we see it.

In any case we will be glad to give you 3D 9H full view tempered glass which is impossible to break glass with.

Please call or txt me at 2058875151

Hi Jessica sorry for your inconvenience but we remember you and have it in our system you told us you attempted to work on your phone yourself and we told you before repair we can’t warranty anything other than the screen because your phone was missing parts and had ripped flex cables when it came in due to the screen being ripped off instead of done correctly. name: Shir
text:
I came in a few months ago with a cracked screen and the screen was replaced. A couple of weeks later my phone was dropped the phone landed on the corner with the case taking direct impact. I also had a screen protector. The screen cracked in the corner.

I have had my phone for a couple of years and the only time the screen cracked previously was when it landed face first without the screen protector. This leads me to believe the quality of the aftermarket screen was not very good.

resp.text:
Hello  Shir, we’re sorry you had a bad experience with us. Aftermarket screens have the same durability as the oem quality the difference is in the picture quality of the lcd only but the glass is the same, also it’s hard to compare the drop it took recently to previous drop lots of factors come into play. You also mentioned it was dropped on the corner of screen which is a very critical place of impact it’s the easiest place to crack on an iPhone specially if it’s the plus size phone but if you stop by we will try our best to make sure you get a better experience with us with a discounted price and free screen protector.

Thank you
Phone Clinic management

name: Theromiles Flowers
text:
I purchased a replacement battery for my Samsung Tab 3 tablet. I received a call on last week that it was in. Had it installed today, July 9, received a call from store that new battery was not fully charged on installation, allowed them to charge the battery for a few hours to see if fully operating, & picked up tablet but battery was not fully charged (37%). Asked about it and they told me that I was have to fully charge it myself.

I would have thought, if I purchased a new battery it would have been fully charged. If I refused this battery and they ordered another battery, it would take another week before it comes in.

This is not good business and this doesn’t seat well with me. They didn’t offered a discount for my inconvenience on a non-fully charged battery.

name: Chris Murray
text: My experience overall was great interacting with the staff there as they were very helpful and friendly. I went in to get a new antenna on my iPhone. After some quick troubleshooting they said they would be able to fix it.  I returned a couple hours later and the signal was a strong 3G, but by the time I got home  I had no tower coverage at all and it was back to the way it was before. Fortunately they do warranty the work they do for six months. I guess I’ll just have to go back in the morning  and see if anything can be done about it.

name: Mayle Underwood
text: Awesome service!!!  I was able to get off work, make an appointment online for that evening, bring my iPhone 8P with a cracked screen in and drop it off, and then pick it up all new and working in an hour!  Customer service was excellent and the price was affordable.  I left a happy camper!  Thank you Guys

text: Made an appt for an IPhone repair. It was promptly taken in, repaired excellently, and ready to go before promised time. Price was $50 lower than other places I checked. Plus a coupon they offered took an additional $10 off! This was 2 weeks ago and so far the phone looks and functions like new -- very happy! I highly recommend this business!

text: People at the store were great. Fixed my battery in 20 minutes. Apple store told me it would take an hour and ten minutes. So far battery is operating fine. I recommend the Huntsville location.

text: My experience was very inconvenient and I was dissatisfied. I dropped the phone off for repair and when I returned to pick it up the screen was not replaced properly. So, they offered to fix it and I went back to work. Returning hours later thinking the phone was repaired, I thought I may want to do a test call to someone to ensure everything was working. It wasn’t. They damaged my earpiece while replacing my screen. My phone screen is very dim now and i can get the phone to charge more than 19%. I will be contacting the corporate headquarters regarding my experience at this location.

name: Lynn Hultman
text:
I first contacted Batteries Plus because my iphone wouldn’t hold a charge.  I suspected I needed to replace it.  The representive told me they had the battery in stock and could probably replace it while I waited.  I had already had a conversation with the local Apple Store and they were not helpful at all.  So I took my phone to Batteries Plus.

The store staff were all very friendly and quite helpful.  My battery was replaced while I waited.  I also thought I had a cracked screen, but the tech told me it the screen protector that was cracked, not the screen. Rather than trying to sell me something, he told me it wasn’t that bad and should be okay.  I decided to replace it anyway, and he assisted me in finding the right product and installed it for me.

While I was waiting, I looked over the products, and saw many that would fit some future needs.   We are relatively new to Huntsville, and I’m so glad  I found this store.  I will definitely shop here again.

Without exception, all the store staff was courteous, very helpful, and professional. I really appreciated that they listened to me and solved my problem.  I never felt rushed, nor did I feel any sales pressure.  I chose the products and service.  What a refreshing experience!

name: Danielle Sinopoli
text: Really straight forward and easy process, was given a $10 off coupon for setting appt up online. They knocked out 2 phones for me in an hour and were pretty busy in the meantime. Would recommend them to anyone.

name: Brad Champion
text: I had to have the screen replaced twice. When I picked up the phone after the first replacement I noticed scratches in the glass and air bubbles underneath the glass. I mentioned it when they handed me the phone. They asked me to bring it back the next day and they would fix it. They did and the second replacement was flawless. Back to looking new.

name: Chris Ethridge
text: Had batteries plus replace the charging port on my I phone because it would not connect to my charger.  Picked up my phone after the repair and am able to charge it fine but now no sound out of the speaker and no service.  Returned to batteries plus to have it looked at and was told by the technician that they replaced the charging port again because the one they previously installed had a small tear in the ribbon cable.  I was informed that this ribbon cable tear is why the speaker and antenna were not working.  When I leave the store for the 2nd time the speaker is now working and I have several bars of service so I assume problem solved.  Over the next day I drop virtually every phone call and service is sporadic going from no service to 4 bars back to 1 bar ever few minutes.  I return to batteries plus and they take my phone back and look at it for 30 min or so and tell me there is nothing they can do to fix it.  I tell them that this problem occurred due to the repair work they performed.  The technician tells me that they could not verify the phone was working 100% prior to them working on it so there is nothing they can do to help.  They suggested I do a software update...I do it and after the update my antenna is still messed up.  I understand they couldn’t test it because it was dead and it wouldn’t take a charge.  I also understand there are unhonest people out there that would take advantage of a repair shop but that is not the case here.  I had a fully functional phone that has never given me any problems just a bad charging port.  My recommendation would be to steer clear of repairing your phone and just trash it for a new one if anything goes wrong with it.  In my case the guys at batteries plus didn’t stand behind their work and cost me $100 and lost me as a customer.  The least they could do is offer a refund since they left me with a non funtioning phone.

name: Dan De Jong
text:
Nice people, terrible service.

I dropped my TV off and they were very pleasant and helpful. They told me they'd call me as soon as it was done. After 4 weeks I called them back. This is where it went down hill.

This was a Friday and they said they'd have it done Monday. I called in Tuesday and it wasn't done. Called back Thursday and they said it would be ready the following Monday. Monday comes around and they have an excuse why it isn't ready. The following week comes up and they finally admit that they can't find the part needed to fix it. I went to pick it up the next day and they said the part was located and would be there in 2 days. A week later I called to check on it and was told the only part in the entire U.S. they could find to fix it (the motherboard) didn't work and they couldn't get another one anywhere else to fix it. So after 6 weeks, I'm where I started at. And all they did was drag there feet in telling me this.

text: The service was good, the repairs made in a decent time frame.  The largest issue I have, is they destroyed the nice acrylic edge of my LCD TV.  Once we got home, and the living room lights reflected off the edge, there were spyder cracks all up and down the right side.  The reason I know this is because, they have a habit of resting the TVs on the edge on concrete.  (You can see evidence of this by walking in the front door)  Unfortunately, some nicer LCDs have trim edges that are easily broken, scuffed, scratched. NO matter how careful you are if you are setting LCD monitors on concrete you will get damage.  Details like this annoy me. Its sooooo easy to have a strip of carpet that would help protect edges and such.  I also am bummed they dont care enough to do this. I do not consider this an over sight, I consider this pure laziness.

This is the first time I've ever written a review,I feel people should be aware of this man.first he will try to convince you he is helping you all I can say is beware!!not only did I pay him $300 for an iPhone 6 that he said was. New,I also traded in my lightly used iphone5
We put minutes on the (new)iPhone 6 and it worked for an hour or so then said no service we called reset it and it worked again for an hour took it back Sam said oh you need new SIM card so we go get one ,NOT the problem he insists it was!!i took it to be checked at another store and they informed me the mother board is no good:((take it back to Sam he says I messed up the screen!! I tell him no I did not the phone was no good since the day I purchased it! He said I will fix it and sell it and give you the money back after he gets his money for screen replacement!!i mean how much money does he need to rob me of
I want my $300 back and my iPhone 5 he. Ow has the iPhone 6 as well so I have lost a large amount of money and he sits waiting for his next victim!! I've contacted a lawyer and that's costing me More Money but worth it I just want to save this from happening to anyone else!!!
Don't be a victim of sams tech

name: Johnathon Carrier
text:
I took my phone in last week to get repaired. By that evening my phone screen went completely black ,and didn't turn back on. I returned the next day to explain that I was just there 24 hours before and my phone didn't work. He verified the purchase and fixed it again. The graphics aren't the same. It has been 7 days and my phone keyboard types on its own and continues to shift between apps, makes calls, and taps on things without me touching it. I will not be returning to this location
Very bad service 😢

name: Caitlin Elliott
text: So, walked in and was promptly greeted. Explained that I needed my screen replaced on my iPhone. I take it out to show the guy and he presses all over it, and while he is telling me my battery is swollen and causing the screen to bend, he turns it on and my screen was split in half! I couldn't use half my screen! I work 2 blocks away and have been very careful with my phone (have had a bent-ish screen for months!) so I really don't think this happened in my pocket. I called him out on it as soon as I saw the screen and he said "Look, you can't even use the screen now". He proceeded to talk about other things with my phone and didn't address the problem of him breaking my screen. He priced a screen and battery for me, but I declined and walked out because he broke my screen and absolutely refused to acknowledge it. I went back to the office, called this place and asked to speak to the manager. He asked what was wrong and I told him about the staff breaking my screen. He reveals that the guy I'm speaking with on the phone is the one who "helped" me in the store, and said that he is the manager and owned the store. I calmly explained to him what he did and how I watched him do it right in front of my face. He REFUSED to take responsibility and tried offering a $10 discount for both screen and battery instead. I said no thanks, and to have a nice day before hanging up. I am SO upset - I ended up just buying a new phone since it was about the same cost of what he would charge for a screen and battery. Find someone honest and who knows what they are doing to fix your cell phone - not here!

name: Candice P. Brownlee
text: I took my iPhone in today to have my cracked screen repaired (at the 15th Street location). The nice man that helped me told me the cost upfront ($130 + tax) and told me it would take about 30 minutes to repair. To me, this was acceptable, fair pricing and excellent timing. Imagine my surprise when he came back 10 minutes later and told me it would only be $10 and my phone was fixed!!! I couldn’t believe it! He informed me that my actual screen wasn’t cracked but that my screen protector sheet was just in bad shape. (It legit LOOKED like it had seeeeveral cracks and several shattered, busted  corners.) I say that to say this... I would’ve never known the difference! He could’ve came back to the counter and still charged me the $130 and I would’ve never known the difference & would have HAPPILY paid it. The Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa COULD HAVE taken advantage of me and again, I would have NEVER KNOWN. I think this SPEAKS VOLUMES of the integrity & honesty of Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa!!! I caught a $120 break today which was much appreciated! I would do business here 100x’s again—even *IF* I ever do have a legit busted screen. My boss recommended me to Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa and I will HIGHLY RECOMMEND them to everyone I know as well! Good people you can TRUST!!! Thank you for the 5-star service today, Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa! I appreciate you more than you know! :-)
