name: Julia Ruderman
text: This happened last February, but I just got around to writing a review now. I broke the LCD screen of my Samsung Galaxy 6 and brought it in to be repaired. They asked for my phone number (I clarified that they wanted the number of the phone I was leaving with them), and told me to come back in a few hours. A few hours later, I come back and they haven't done anything yet. They said they'd have to replace the frame of my phone (because it would break when they removed it) as well but they didn't have a matching gold one in stock and needed my permission to use a white frame instead. The guy said "we called you but couldn't get in touch"...well yeah, you called the phone in your hand. So whatever, I come back a few hours later and it's still not done and I have to wait another half hour. I finally get it back and the frame is extended a few millimeters from the front of my phone- hard to describe but made it more difficult to press the home button and felt very fragile. A few months later, the frame is starting to peel off and I hear a crackling noise every time I press the screen. I took it to a different phone repair place back home, where I was told the first repair was incredibly sloppy. The guy there told me the first repair hadn't even glued the frame back on and it was a miracle it hadn't fallen off yet. For less than $50 (and in under an hour), he glued it on correctly and my phone looks new (aside from the mismatched front). I'm giving 2 stars because I understand things like the mismatched frame isn't their fault, and I knew it was going to be pricey, but overall it was not a good experience at all.

resp.text: Please contact us and let us know how we can improve. Phoneclinictuscaloosa@gmail.com

Hey Tyler sorry to hear that. But in electronic world you will be given "Limited warranty" which will not cover physical damages. When you have any complains you need to bring it before you crack.

We ate not production facility, we buys this parts from our suppliers, which give us limited warranty as well.

Luckily there is something called surveillance camera with advanced sound system.

This person clearly states that he is ready to take the risk and accepts the statement read told to him orally by our technician.

There is nothing written that is correct but we are experienced enough to know that in certain phones like "Chinese Huawei" brand there are some complications due to design of the phone:

As another example Samsung galaxy S5 has all the main screws underneath the screen. To do any internal work one needs to remove the screen, which is risky. We always mention this.

It is not fair to blame others afterwards.

This person takes the phone to our fellow repair shop and they fixed it  for him for 240$ just the screen. Cause part is very costly.

text: I went in with a working phone just battery was dying fast. Got there around 10 am paid for a new battery waited a few hours like I was told returned with the same issue. They took my phone to the back came back said they over heated it and it no longer works. I had a iPhone 6. They refused to replace my phone. I called the cops and still nothing was done. DO NOT TAKE YOUR Phone TO THEM EVER!!!!

resp.text:
Hey Nakia. As far as I learned from the technician your Motherboard was heating and draining battery. There was a short circuit or some burned diode. Initially we could not notice it and per your request changed the battery.

Then the second time you came back we let you to touch your motherboard by your own hands, We have the video record of it. which you could not touch even for a second. It was burning almost

So lets make it clear it is not we heated your board. It was your board was overheating. We told you it can burn PMU (Power management ic chip) if keep trying it. You said go ahead and work on it.

We offered you refund back on battery we installed but you tried different ways to get over and ask for a brand new phone.

First of all if you come to us its because your phone does not work well. It is 3 years old phone with heating board.

we just took our battery of it and refunded you 45$

Sorry but we can not buy you a brand new iPhone 7 to make you happy.

Note: you sat in the store 8 hours in front desk and gave all the customers entering store bad reputation. This is not ethical at all.

text: Liars,I dropped off my Samsung with them paid 100.00 to fix it .they said it would be ready in two to three days so after not hearing from them I called ,said part hadn't arrived will be ready in 3 days .again no response so I went there 7 days 8 days from the initial drop off.I was told part would be in in 5 days so I came back.part hasn't arrived I'm told by a Arab fellow behind the counter after a heavy set white fellow said he would have to check and see what was wrong, and seemEd to give me a weird vibe in his way of acting .then Arab guy says your part is in Oregon should be here in 5 days and said so what do you want to do ? I say just give me my phone and a refund I'll take it elsewhere. I had already spent money on another phone that I brought home and doesn't work but I wasn't going to say anything about it.so then he says we can't do that ! I asked why and his answer was store policy ! It's my phone I own it ,it's my money ,I have had no service plus at the time it was 13 days far from the original 2 or 3 I was told .then he couldn't find my phone so I waited approximately 30 mins and the white guy comes out and says and you could see he was stalling.and said so what are you going to do?I said I'm waiting on my phone and my money.the Arab guy comes back hollering at the back find that phone .said I wasn't listening and I wasn't getting anything and proceeds to pull a sticker off my phone.I said I want my phone my money and leave that sticker on it .he said he didn't have to.took the sticker off and my phone to the back.at this point I was outraged,grabbed his moniter layer it over a said give me my damn phone and he called the police,police said it was a litagation issue when I talked to them and the thievery was not a 911 police matter .also if you look at the mama's of the 5 stars on this page you will find common ground in 85% of the names ! Today is day 19 one extra day from the last time I spoke with the liars at the phone clinic, I'll be returning to check in on things today with a real phone tech.and offer them one last chance to let them make it right,today ! The business is out of my way and would have never even went there had I not called ahead of time and was told the normal wait was a hour  ! I expect some kind of lie as a reply on here and I also feel I've been robbed by this business at this point ! BEWARE!

name: Homero El Malo
text:
(Translated by Google) They repair your cell phone the same day (it takes about 3 hours), but first you have to go to make a previous diagnosis, for this you have to go to the laboratory, leave an advance so that they order the accessory or damaged part and wait for the delivery time which is indicated on the day of the diagnosis (all that time you keep the equipment with you). On the agreed day you have to call to find out if the part finally arrived and if so, you take the equipment and they repair it instantly, excellent service.

(Original)
Te reparan el celular el mismo día (toma alrededor de 3 horas), pero primero hay que ir a realizar un diagnóstico previo, para esto hay que ir al laboratorio, dejar un anticipo para que realizen el pedido del accesorio o pieza dañada y esperar por el tiempo de entrega la cual se te indica el día del diagnostico (todo ese tiempo mantienes el equipo contigo). En el día acordado hay que llamar para saber si la pieza finalmente llego y de ser así llevas el equipo y te lo reparan en el instante, excelente servicio.

name: Jazlyn Terry
text:
Name should be: ubreakibreakmore

Brought my Google Pixel 4XL in to have a screen replacement through Verizon insurance. I dropped off the phone at 10am and agreed to a 4-6 hour wait time. Everything worked on the phone when it was dropped off, damage was strictly cosmetic (I have a receipt with a checklist and phone history to prove this). Gave another phone number for shop to call when finished. I return at 6:30pm (because shop closes at 7) to see what is going on with my phone and they bring it out with a still broken screen. They could not fix the screen, but apparently messed up more in the process. The phone will now not function AT ALL. It will not even turn off. I was not given any resolution other than call Verizon and file a claim, which is the exact reason I was here to start with.

STAY AWAY!!!!

text: Fast scheduling, part was in inventory when I called (Pixel 3a screen). As a Google authorized service provider, I had confidence going in, and I wasn't disappointed. Jason did a fantastic repair, efficient, and courteous. Highly recommended! Hope I don't have to go back, but if necessary, I will!

Great place to get your electronics fixed. I had to get a Galaxy Note 9 screen replaced, the website gives you an exact quote of how much it will cost. It wasn't too bad, I five other repair shops both in Madison and Huntsville, they all gave me about the same price for the repair. The technician gave me an estimated wait time (an hour) and said it will be done by then. I got called within 45 minutes, and the screen was as good as new. Pretty straight forward process.

The price was decent compared to what it would cost me to buy the screen from a supplier, labor cost wasn't too bad either. They did a fine job. Thanks!

name: Richard Swaim
text: My iPhone had a broken screen and housing (back glass) when I brought it in for repairs.  Anthony explained the process thoroughly and provided me with a loaner phone because they didn’t have the housing in stock.  The part was overnighted to the store and repaired the next day.  Unfortunately, due to a defect in my particular phone the repair was unsuccessful and had to have some sort of wiring replaced for the home button- which needed to be done by Apple in California.  Anthony again communicated very well and advised me of every step throughout the process. He worked tirelessly and even came in on his off day to get it resolved.  My phone was replaced and is now working better than ever.  Anthony is an asset to this company.  His customer service and communication skills are fantastic and were throughout the entire process.  I will recommend these guys to all my friends and family and would not hesitate to take my devices back if any repairs are needed in the future.

text: I’d give 10 stars if possible. name: Heather Bartlett
text:
If you like waiting your gas and time...this is the place to go!

Let me start off by saying I made an appointment a week in advance I also called before I made the appointment! I use my phone for work everyday and I'm from Cullman, every local place said they would need my phone for 3 days so I took off work a saturday and made the appointment as soon as I got off the phone with them to get my s10 plus screen replaced, because they said they had it and it would be done that day, they seem to this there was some miscommunication and didnt hear the plus, which I would have been a little bit more understanding if I didnt make an online appointment a week early, I put exactly what I needed and what phone I had color and all they had one screen but it was the wrong color and because they are a samsung partners the back has to be the same color? I walked out of that place with no help, no suggestions, I felt like they could not care less if I walked out having drove over an hour, to me, this is one of the worse customer service experiences I have ever had, this was clearly a mistake on their side yet nothing was done to even try and make it right! A shout out to companies that care...batteries + bulbs went out of their way to make sure this other companies mistake was created, not only did they get it fixed but due to bad weather they let me get out of there quick and jumped right on everything! I get mistakes happen, but I also understand customers are what make a business, I got not even an apology management was called and I was told theres nothing I can do but order one! At that point I was so aggravated I would have turned my phone in for 3 days...I will not recommended nor use this place

resp.text: Hello Heather, thank you for providing your honest feedback. I do apologize for any miscommunication about part availability for your repair. We take all feedback as a learning experience, and will be using your words to help is improve in the future with our services. If you would like to discuss this further you are welcome to reach out to our customer support team at (877) 320-2237 10am-10pm EST Monday through Saturday or 12pm-8pm EST Sunday.

name: Amy Mansell
text: Was quoted a price on the phone, and told there was a price match. Got there, had a price from another store and was told $50 more than both prices I was given.

resp.text:
Hello Amy,

Thank you for sharing a review about your visit to the West Huntsville uBreakiFix. We believe in both exceptional customer service and providing an accurate, competitive repair cost, so I would like to extend my sincere apologies for the experience you had. Our price match policy is valid for any brick-and-mortar competitor's location within 10 miles, offering the same repair at regular price with equal-quality parts - we will match their price plus beat it by $5. If you would like to discuss the details of your visit further, or have any other questions for us, then please feel free to contact either the West Huntsville store leadership, or our Customer Support team at 1 (877) 320-2377 Monday - Saturday 10AM-10PM EST, and Sunday 12PM-8PM EST.

text: Great service!

name: Mitchell Ross
text: Ordered a small part from this company a few weeks ago. After realizing it was the wrong part I sent a few emails trying to iniatw a return.  Totally ghosted me. Thankfully it wasn't very expensive

name: Randy Driscoll
text:
First of all, I am from Canada.  I called today to order a part.  He asked me to describe the symptoms that my Samsung Plasma was experiencing.  Rather than just sell me the part as so many sites have done (I've replaced almost every board in the tv so far)He ran me through a common fix (soldering issue) and asked me to call him back to let him know how I made out.  The fix worked and cost me nothing.  I have been talking to a local repair shop and I never got this kind of service.

Good for Huntsville to have his shop and customer service!

On another note, through just everyday conversation (I am Canadian), I learned that his son is a Doctor in that area.    I'm sure his "customer service" has been handed down!!!

Thanks So Much!!!!!

Randy D
Quispamsis, NB, Canada

Their team reached out to me via email and asked if I needed any assistance completing the order. This small gesture went a long way. Items were just as described. Shipped fast. Packaged well. A+.

text:
These guys/gals were very helpful. I emailed with one of their reps before making my purchase to make sure the repair was within the scope of my abilities, he assured me that no special tools were needed for my application. Great customer service, I saved a bunch of money compared to buying new, and kept more waste out of landfill.

name: Casey Jones
text: Hi never give reviews cause iam super picky but you guys are excellent from placing the order to recieving it was amazing i,ve been in service for 40 years and in those years there has only been 1 or 2 companies that stood out enough for me to take the time to give a review your one of them i will spread the word to every person i talk with so from the people who ship all the way to the owner your doing things the right way and it was a pleasure to be able to work with you as far as getting me the right parts and a short time keep up the good work and thanks again

Called again today and found out it was never sent, we'll see if that changes this week.. disappointed so far.

text: My TV when black and wouldn’t show a picture I was determinate that I could, fix my TV myself. I thank you Mr. G and the staff for getting the part to me so fast. A GREAT Company to do business with..

The wife's computer screen was cracked and I was not comfortable making the repair myself. Patrick had us all fixed up in just a couple hours! Well worth the drive from Jasper to Fultondale! Very reasonable prices!

His shop is located in the strip with Domino's,  across Decatur Hwy from Winn Dixie.

name: J S
text:
I brought my cellphone in for a screen repair last year. The screen got repaired, but they neglected the digitizer! They still charged me the full screen repair price. Took to another place that fixed it, but had to pay them too! Strike 1.

Sometime later I brought another phone in for repair. Didn't hear from them for about a week so I gave them a call. They said they were either working or it or getting to it soon. Another 2 weeks pass and nothing, so I called again. Strike 2.

They gave me the same story. Another 2 weeks pass and I call again because they can't seem to call their customers and tell them what's going on. They tell me the same thing! How long does it take to replace a screen and ODIN the firmware!?!?! Strike 3.

So after a month or more passed, I said screw it and went and got my phone that was still unrepaired. I took it to Total Cellphone Repair down the road who got my phone up and running in 2 hours!

Avoid Mobile Spot at all costs! They don't know what they're doing and don't care about returning customers!

resp.text: Hey Jeff S, we checked our data files in our computer, but could not find a customer profile that matched your first name and last initial with tickets related to  the issues you’ve stated. If you did have a bad experience with us, we do apologize. We strive to take care of all of our customers, and have them walking out of our store happy. name: Hinton Family
text:
Friends, parents, smartphone users- MEET YOUR NEW BEST FRIEND!
My son's tablet (his tablet=my sanity) stopped working properly. The microphone no longer responded, so instead of learning to speak more clearly my son was constantly needing help to type... Then a friend told me about MobileSpot and how good they were.

Good is an understatement. I went by with my son and Mr Green talked with us and fixed the microphone while we visited! He did some troubleshooting and found it was an operating system error. Then because he didnt have to take it apart...he didnt charge us!???  He just asked that we come see him if we ever do need more.

This tablet is my son's world, as a functionally non-verbal person with autism. My son is also an excellent judge of character...He completely trusted Mr Green. There were no tears or awkwardness. We were comfortable and accepted while Mr Green worked his magic.

This business is not just good, but great. Good, genuine people you can trust. Honest, capable and skilled help when you need it!

resp.text: Always our pleasure! Thank you for the 5 Star Review!

name: Wendy Robertson
text: If I could select ZERO I would.  This was the most unprofessional experience I have ever had.  I just wasted 3 hours of my life yesterday and 1.5 hours today based on what I was told when I called to request a repair to my electronic device.  I was told to bring it at 3:30 and they would have it ready in two hours so I drove to the store.  When I returned in 2.5 hours no one had touched it.  However, Carter the manager said he would take care of it and I could pick it up at 11:00 am today.  He even called to see if a white screen would be ok.  So, I called three times today to check on it and still no one has fixed it and the manager is not in the store.  The guy at the counter wasn’t working he was watching TV.  PLEASE do NOT waste your time going to this store.  Horrible experience!

name: Rochon Hall Jr.
text:
If I could give this place ZERO stars, I definitely would.

I brought my MacBook Pro in 1.5 Months prior to the Covid-19 shutdown for a screen repair which the stated was an easy fix. After 2 weeks of not hearing anything, I decided to call for an update. I spoke with someone who stated that for those 2 weeks, their technician was out and would be returning back to work today to have a look. I brushed it off and said, keep me updated. One week later, I called for another update and spoke with a different employee who stated that my part had been ordered. I asked him "which part did you guys order?" (as I was curious), he stated "aw man, I don't know I just got here".....Turns out no part was ever ordered. They kept my MacBook during the COVID shutdown, never called and asked me to come and pick it up prior to,  never did any type of work, almost lost my charger, never took responsibility for anything and never even called back once they opened to come pick up my computer. THESE GUYS ARE TERRIBLE! Trust me when I say, DO NOT TAKE ANY DEVICE HERE FOR REPAIR! I tried to give them multiple chances, as well as business advice, but they refused to listen. I asked to speak to the owner and they refused. STAY AWAY.

name: Lindsey Wiley
text: Great experience. Super quick and affordable place to get phones fixed!

name: Tyra jeaneen
text: If i could give this place zero stars i would. I have never in my life been so rudely spoken to as a customer by a manager. This place messed my entire phone up, to where i can’t even scroll I can’t answer calls or end them. I have been back down here 4 times because the first screen they“ fixed” literally didn’t work it wouldn’t let me do anything that had to do with scrolling typing anything so  I take it back up there to the same person named Carter Smith and he was like ok I’ll put a new screen on so he changes the screen AGAIN i leave a couple days later this phone randomly pixelates out and the screen turns black and doesn’t come back on for hours and then it comes back on for five minutes same thing happens. I take it back he puts on another screen same thing happens the next day he proceeds to tell me it’s my phone and that i just need to buy a whole new phone when it never did this prior to him fixing it. He was VERY rude. All he kept saying to my girlfriend and I was he wasn’t going to deal with rude customers and that i can get a broken screen put back on and he’ll give me a refund and I can leave him and “his buisness” alone. He also said to me so you’re the one who went to school and got a degree on fixing phones didn’t you? He was no help at all. He is a scam artist. He kept demanding me to hand him my phone so I could get out of his store so he didn’t have to deal with me. When I told him what was wrong with my phone all he would say is cool, that’s your phones problem, not mine and i’m not dealing with it. I asked him who was in charge he said me, i said okay who’s in charge and who’s above you? he said me again. He told me I could leave a bad review and that nothing would happen anyways because that’s his store so I asked him if he was the owner? he said well no but If you want to leave a bad review you have to do it on the phone repair nationwide website and reminded me again that it wouldn’t matter i’m not going to get anywhere with a bad review. So now i’m stuck with a screen that doesn’t work and i’m out of $140. I’m beyond upset.

name: Alex Springer
text:
Brought a phone in for a screen repair. After the repair, the home button wasn't working. When talking about the problem and looking for a fix, the technician was very friendly but the manager was an absolute jerk who continued to shift blame while sarcastically mocking every one of our complaints. "Cool" is not an appropriate response when a customer has a complaint or an idea.

Every time we spoke with the manager, his explanation for why it wasn't their fault went from "it was starting to fail already" (which isn't possible for a non-mechanical button) to "the new screen isn't mapped to this button" (which doesn't explain why the old screen, when replaced back on the phone, still didn't work with the button). It very quickly became clear he had no intention of having a conversation and instead wanted to get rid of us as soon possible.

This was made clear when he stopped replying to our questions and started replying with "cool" or "ok lady I don't know." Finally he resorted to "it could have been us but we can't be held liable," and offered a refund.

Never in my life have I had such a bratty, rude, and absolutely childish manager berate me and my fiancee with such an immature attitude.

name: Laura Calvert
text: Carter is the BEST at phone repairs! I’ve come in multiple times and he’s been efficient and the pricing is extremely fair. Carter has all my phone and phone repair answers and I’ve never had a problem. 10/10 would recommend

name: Rex Anderson
text:
I took my mini I-Pad in on 05/04/2015 with a cracked screen. At first, I was told it would be completed in 3 hours. I paid $141.69 up front for the repair. When I went back after it, I was told the manager (Justin) didn't realize it was the "new generation" & would have to order a new screen & it would be a "few days". When the new screen came in, somehow during the reassemble a solder point was broken that he did not have the expertise to repair. Long story short, it was sent to Jersey City, NJ twice. On 06/03/2015 (33 days after original drop off date) I was told the manager was going to have to buy me a new pad as he still could not complete the repair on mine.
When the new pad came, he could not transfer all the apps & photos from my  old unit. I then went to Verizon to have it completed.
The manager, during this time showed minimal customer service consideration. There were two individuals in particular that showed both concern & interest in my problems.
For that, I would like to commend both Jeremy & Carter. In my opinion, Carter has both the technical & managerial skills needed for this store to be a continued success.

resp.text: Thanks for sharing your experience, Rex. We can certainly understand your frustration -- we should have done a better job communicating with you about the work we were doing on your iPad. We know we're better than this, and hope we'll get another chance to show you that in the future. -Best, MyPhone Repair Team

name: Greg M
text: I really like the way they approached my Sony battery replacement. They were very nice and kept in touch letting me know what was going on during the repair time they had it physically in their hands. I don't know what all the naysayers are griping about, but I am not one of them. The guy at the front counter (can't remember his name) was on top of things the whole time. Give them a try!

name: Jennifer Williams
text: Wonderful experience. Knowledgeable staff. Quick turnaround. Had my screen replaced on iPhone then several months later when I had some trouble they fixed it. My daughter’s phone had bad water damage and they fixed it. Said if we have any problems later it was covered. GREAT service!!

name: Brenda Lee
text: I took my phone here to see if they could bypass Google sign in on my phone. The service was Awesome. Carter is a one man full service team all by himself. Customer service is great and no long wait. I would use him again, if needed, and will surely recommend him to my friends.

name: Alexis Rooks
text: I went there to get my screen fixed for my iPhone 7 Plus and yes they replaced my screen but now my home button doesn’t work because they broke the cable that connects it to the screen. They didn’t charge me for the screen replacement but still my home button doesn’t work at all. No fingerprint scanner or anything. So I finally get home with my phone and my front camera looks blurry. Literally, my camera looked like an Android’s camera so I went back up there and they somewhat fixed it but it’s still not the same quality it was before. I prefer that if they know it would be risky to replace my screen without breaking my home button that they tell me upfront before we start the process to just give me a heads up to make sure that it is okay instead of taking the risk and then telling me it’s completely broken. If they would have told me upfront I would have just went to Apple so they could fix my screen for about $170 without breaking my home button but now I have to go to Apple to get it fixed for $350. This place is a waste of time and energy! Please stay away especially if you have an iPhone 7 Plus.

name: Stephen Cantonwine
text: Fast, low price, and top tier customer service. Took less than 1 hour to replace the screen and less than 20 minutes to get my home button replace. The second time I had to go in because the button fell out of place with the new screen and he replaced the button which is normally $30 at no charge.

name: Anne Wolf
text:
Brought a phone in for a screen repair. After the repair, the home button wasn't working. When talking about the problem and looking for a fix, the technician was very friendly but the manager was an absolute jerk who continued to shift blame while sarcastically mocking every one of our complaints. "Cool" is not an appropriate response when a customer has a complaint or an idea.

Every time we spoke with the manager, his explanation for why it wasn't their fault went from "it was starting to fail already" (which isn't possible for a non-mechanical button) to "the new screen isn't mapped to this button" (which doesn't explain why the old screen, when replaced back on the phone, still didn't work with the button). It very quickly became clear he had no intention of having a conversation and instead wanted to get rid of us as soon possible.

This was made clear when he stopped replying to our questions and started replying with "cool" or "ok lady I don't know." Finally he resorted to "it could have been us but we can't be held liable," and offered a refund.

Never in my life have I had such a bratty, rude, and absolutely childish manager berate me and my fiancé  with such an immature attitude

name: Susan Baldaia
text: I was told by the Verizon store that I needed a new phone  or in order to diagnose it I  needed to go to the Apple store!  I not only did NOT need a new phone  but I had a wonderful experience at your Huntsville store!  Bear and Nate were great and replaced the plug in a very timely manner.  I  highly recommend this store to fix your iPhone!!!  Thank you!

name: Shauna Hamlin
text: POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! Went in there Sunday to get my screen repaired. They didn’t have it in stock and had to order it and wouldn’t be in until Friday. I paid extra to rush ship it and the tech said it should be there Tuesday evening or Wed morning. I called Wed at late lunch and the part wasn’t even ordered. The owner said he would order it and it would be here Friday. I asked him to refund my extra money for rush since it wasn’t rushed. He refused to and couldn’t understand why I felt like he should refund it. He also “accidentally” hung up on me twice trying to converse about this.

name: Shirleyann Gilbreath
text: Good advice regarding phone battery from rep. Also gave me some pointers on how to save phone.

text: Always a great professional experience. It is very rare that you are charged $30 less than you initial quote. My computer is working like it is brand new. Thanks

name: Emily Turner
text: Went today to get a simple crack in my phone fixed, told it would be 1-2 hours to repair it. I left it there and went back home and had planned to pick it up in a little while. After 4 hours had passed, I called to make sure it was ready. When one of the techs answered he told me that Hunter- the tech that worked on my phone- would call me back in just a minute be he did not know anything about it. I never got a call back from Hunter. So I called again and they told me they couldn't put my phone back together bc the tool that they had to use to do it had striped and they couldn't do anything until Monday. I called apple to see if they could take a look and they told me to bring it in, so I did, only two find out he striped the entire cable that made my phone work. I would have to pay over $300 for a new phone. When I had only paid $100 for it in the first place. Needless to say I am unhappy and will never be going back.

name: Robbie
text: Don’t understand the bad reviews. Had a pretty bad cracked screen on my iPhone 6. I was out of there in 10 minutes with a new screen plus a complimentary screen protector. Fast, efficient, and only cost $70. The tech was honest and upfront with everything. Highly recommend.

name: Preston Jones
text: It was a really good experience. They put a tempered glass screen on my iphone.

name: Layla Nix
text:
Came to this place because didn’t want to wait 4 hours of wait at Apple.
Guess I should’ve had, because after that it was terrible.
Went to get the screen fixed ($100) not bad at all, came back to pick it up 30min later & ended up with a black screen when the phone was gold, he said he would order the white screen for my phone and he will call me when it arrived.
So already that was an inconvenience for me.
After that I noticed that the quality of the screens this place uses were bad,
Because the colors changed a lot, they had a yellowish tone, so I called back to see if he could order a better quality and he said he would, for ($50) more.
So there it’s already more expensive than apple.
Anyways I said go ahead an ordered it,
So about a week later I went to go get the Premium Screen put on and left.
After using the phone at home I noticed that it was hard typing and using the actual phone because it would ghost touch all over the screen or sometimes not touch at all. PROBLEM THAT I DIDN’T HAVE WITH THE CHEAPER SCREEN FIRST.
Anyways I gave a call and he said he would order a new one and he would call me when it arrived.
After about a week I never got a call so I went in, to find out he probably didn’t order the screen because he didn’t have it.
ANYWAYS THAT WAS MY 4th TIME HAVING TO DRIVE THERE.
A couple days later I called and he finally had the screen, so I went again and he replaced it & said that should fix the problem. I left and after using my phone noticed the problem was worst. So the next day I drive there for the 6th time & told him this was not working for me, so I’m guessing he got in his feelings, & said (and I quote) “We can do two things, either you can just ROCK WITH IT, or I can take off that screen and put a cracked screen & give you a refund”
So I said well give me a refund so I can take it to apple, so I’m waiting for 15 min and I go back to pick up the phone, a cracked screen of course.
So then he has the audacity to ask for a receipt I said well I don’t have it, I shouldn’t need one I’ve drove to this place 6 times in the last 3 weeks & he still asks for a receipt.
Which of course were 2 receipts one for the $100 and the 2nd one for $50.
So he said there is nothing I can do.
So at this point I’m mad because I have a cracked screen and no refund. So I said well put the other screen I guess I’ll take it like that.

So overall guys, GO TO APPLE OR SOMEWHERE where they know what they are doing.
Because obviously this place doesn’t.
I should’ve read the bad reviews before I went here.
Because now I have to pay more money to fix the screen again for something I could’ve payed once at a professional place.
I’m not the person to write bad reviews but after driving 6 times to this place and wasting time and then basically still having a messed up well I had no choice to write this so other people don’t go through this problem.

name: Cheryl Montgomery
text: 5 STAR!!! EXCELLENT SERVICE AND VERY HELPFUL AND ON POINT !! IN & OUT !! CARTER IS THE BOMB . 👐

text:
I was told in Facebook to come here and give a bad review. I guess if people are gullible enough to try and take there cheap road instead of doing the Apple Store repair and Apple warranty this is what they get.

However you found stand behind your work and not try to cover up your mistakes.

text: My son broke the screen on his IPhone X and it was fixed in less than an hour and a great price!  Cheaper than anyone else we spoke to including the Apple Store.  Will definitely recommend.

name: Alisha King
text: This is the worst place I have ever been to, I would not let them touch anything i had. I took my sons phone there to see if it could be fixed. Carter said that he could fix the phone but he would have to order basically a whole new inner part to phone. I asked what if it does not work after that? Carter said he would return money and get parts he could use them.So after 2 weeks he finally says after I call once again it is done. I go to get phone battery is low he tells me it is because hasn’t been charged, after told me he had been charging all day to see if worked. So I tell him I thought you charged all day? Carter said no been charging and letting phone die all day to make sure turns back on! So get home charge phone and it charged all night to take to get SIM card next day, phone goes dead within two hours. Carter said ordered new battery🙄 so get phone to Company to place sim and it won’t recognize SIM card. Obviously the phone is not fixed. So I call Carter who tells me no problem. I will refund money towards a new phone and can order . I said how much would that cost? I had already paid 160. He said I would get brand new phone for 180 more. I told him I would probably just get a phone or order through insurance because the phone can’t be fixed. Carter proceeds to tell me he has worked for those companies and they are crooks. They don’t give you new phones but phones that have same problem yours had. He gets phones from company that are new and that’s why cost more than insurance. . At that point said ok and waited weeks without phone because said they were out of stock. I finally told him I was coming to get refund because I was going to buy phone and not to worry about it. So I take the phone, Carter tells me it will be a couple hours. I said ok then Carter calls me and said I can’t refund your money because this phone has had a new screen placed on it. I said it didn’t need a screen when brought it. The screen was not cracked. He said yeah we had to replace screen. I said if you replaced screen then that’s the screen you replaced. I have not took the phone anywhere else and why would I when waiting on phone to supposedly be ordered! Carter then said I can show you I make a mark on all my screens. I said I don’t know what kind of mark you make but apparently you forgot to do it because no one has touched that phone. Nobody worked on that phone besides these crooks! They did not fix the phone! Carter blatantly lied to me and never intended to refund my money. He made sure he was gone when my husband went to get phone. They had no idea who husband was but handed him the phone. This is the worst so called business I have ever worked with. Carter who called other people crooks was the crook! Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere. I give 0 stars!!

text: The service was wonderful, and the price was fair, I would recommended my Phone Repair in parkway mall to everyone.

text: Friendly service, quick turnaround, and good results. Twice we've had fast and reasonably priced fixes from these guys for a shattered screen and a broken power button. Will return again anytime our phones need care.

name: Katherine Ogletree
text: I am beyond please with the rapid repair and incredible customer service! Elliot is amazing!  Thank you so much for repairing my phone!

name: Aaron Hearne
text: My phone is one of the more difficult phones to do repairs on, which is why I took it in to have the battery replaced rather than do it myself. My hope was that a repair shop would have more experience and would have more finesse than I. The price they charged was right in line with other repair shops in the area, and it was convenient being able to shop around in the mall while they did repairs. I was disappointed to get my phone back and find that the phone had dents and chips all over the place from where they pulled it apart, and they even broke the camera glass and bent the back panel. It seems like they didn't watch the youtube videos available for my phone repair because he said the glass broke because they forgot there were screws placed behind it. I don't know if I could have done a job equal to what they did and saved ~$50, but I guess we'll never know. the guys at the shop had no problem purchasing and replacing the ganked up parts at no cost, but I had to wait weeks for the replacement parts to arrive. My experience is most likely different from what other people will have since my phone is not common and parts are not readily in stock and it is difficult to repair. I would also say that if your phone is easier than mine you might be able to buy the replacement parts yourself and browse youtube and save yourself some money. You could probably do just as well a job and leave just as many marks in your phone if you did it yourself. Also, they don't tend to call you when your parts arrive. The date they give you of when your parts will arrive is 100% accurate, but they will not call you. You are better off calling them or showing up yourself in the store.

name: Debra Darkow
text: Terrible customer service skills and they break your screen and do not fix it. I will never go back here again! They do not stand behind their work or product.

name: chiana walker
text: DO NOT GO HERE! I took my iphone 6 here and I was told to come back in 45 minutes, well that turned into 4 1/2 hours. I initially  came back an hour later and was told they needed more time so i patiently waited outside. Then I tried another hour and I came back to them telling me that broke a part to my phone while fixing it and they would have to order that part. Also, along with them breaking that part to my phone it affected my touch ID. The guy apologized and told me it would be fixed but THEY COULD NOT FIX IT and then tried to say maybe I came in with it working when I know i absolutely did not! My iPhone then started to continuously turn off and on and they didn't know how to fix it. To top it all off they offered me only $75 after breaking my IPhone. The manager does not care and even after the employees told him all the damage they did to my phone he looked at me and said "well you have no proof that all of that stuff was not broken before you came in here" AGAIN DO NOT GO HERE.

name: Shelton Wright
text: Elliot was awesome! Tried to fix my broken screen myself and failed. Elliot had me going again in just a few minutes. Will definitely be back if I break another!

name: Ashley White
text: Dropped my sons fully functioning iPad off for a screen repair (small glass crack) and was told it would be ready in a week.  After a week I returned and the man brings it to me in pieces stating it's not ready yet,... Next week I return and I'm told it has to be sent off that it will be back in a week.  Two weeks later (a total of four weeks) it's returned.  The sound doesn't work and the screen spasms out making it inoperable.  I spent $151 to be ripped off and returned an iPad that doesn't function worth a darn.  Save yourself the headache and just go to Apple.  expensive lesson to learn :(

resp.text:
Ashley,

We strive for the best service and quality. We are very suprised to hear you had a bad experience with us. We appreciate your feedback and will be taking the appropriete measures to resolve any issues.

Best Regards,

Team MyPhone

name: Carrie Helmick
text: It's been over a month since I paid the deposit for them to order my phone screen. Was originally told it would be 3 or 4 days. Came in and was told that was wrong  It normally takes a couple of weeks to come in. No phone call when it finally did come in. I just happened to stop by. They said come back in 20 minutes. I come back and they say the new screen didn't work. They will order a new one and call me asap when it comes in. Several weeks again and no word. I go back today and the guy thinks it came in but can't find it. Wanted me to come back tomorrow. I said no. Have the manager call me. We'll see if I get a call from them. If not  I will get my money back  to deposit. They've made no effort whatsoever to keep me updated on anything. I'm really sick of it .

name: Will Cagle
text:
This was the worst experience, I’ve had at a retail store in a Long Time! At first they said it would cost $70 to replace the screen on my sons, I phone 6, and would take 30 or 45 mins, We came back 45 mins later, and they claimed another part of the phone was broken, when THEY had to remove the battery for the screen replacement..,and now the ID- (thumbprint) wouldn’t work,  and it would now be an
Additional $15, and would take another 10 or 15 mins, we returned almost a half hour later and his phone was still in the guys hands in pieces! That’s when they said, ‘someone else had worked on the phone previously, and it was ‘un fixable’.so I told them just put the broken screen BACK on!  The phone was bought brand new and only been serviced once and that was at the APPLE store!’ in bridge St., and When my 12 yr old told them this, they called him a liar. So long story short, they took his phone for almost two hours, fixed nothing, but did manage to break the ID, fingerprint function, which worked fine, before the phone was left in their care! Called him a liar, and he left in tears  because his phone was WORSE when we got it back, then before we left it with them!! DO NOT USE THIS PLACE!! They make their prices sound cheaper, but then pull the ‘ol bait and switch’ and by the time you left. (If they even fix your phone) you could of got it fixed  at APPLE, by PROFESSIONALS, for the same price!!

name: Daniel Holbrook
text:
Took my HTC one m8 in for repair. The repair failed and needed redone. That lasted about 4 months before I got my device back. Now that I finally have it back, my screen is not properly installed (working it's way loose), my SD card reader no longer works, and my device now rattles very loud when it vibrates/ plays sound.

The techs in the store were very friendly and they tried very hard to get my device fixed.

My device had many issues as it was a "special order". They primarily repair iPhones. If I had an iPhone I'm sure my experience would have been exceptional.

I'm still waiting to hear back from the store to see if I can just get a new device ordered and give them mine.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear your experience hasn't been as seamless as we all would have liked, Daniel. We appreciate you bringing this issue to our attention -- your satisfaction means everything to us. If you'd like to chat further, please feel free to give us a call at (256) 715-1516. -Best, MyPhone Repair Team

name: Jackson McAnally
text: My friend referred me to MyPhone Repair because they had repaired his cracked Iphone screen in the past, and I had the same problem.  Upon arriving at the store, I noticed that there was only one employee available and a lot of customers already waiting.  After discussing my phone screen issue and paying $110 up front with no work done yet, I learned that my problem should only take about 15 minutes to fix.  After waiting for about two and a half hours, my phone was returned to me with what looked to be a proper repair.  About an hour after leaving the store, I noticed that my front camera wasn't working.  I turned my phone off, hoping to reset everything, thus fixing the problem.  Instead of turning back on, the Apple logo would appear, disappear, then reappear with these small codes on the top part of my screen.  My phone would not turn back on.  I returned to MyPhone Repair the next day to see what the deal was.  Evidently, my phone was rejecting the new screen.  To solve this problem, the employee has to keep trying new screens until he finds one that doesn't get rejected.  There is a chance that I will lose everything on my phone and the use of my phone in general.  I still have not received any update on my second phone repair after dropping it off nearly four hours ago.  So... I enter the store with what is made out to be a very minor problem, pay a very unreasonable amount for the repair before the repair is even done, and then leave the store with an even bigger problem than I came in with.  I'm highly unsatisfied with my Myphone Repair experience.  Everything has been very inconvenient and unclear and unsolved.

resp.text: We can certainly understand your frustration in this situation, Jackson. We always aim to get your phone fixed as quickly as possible, and if the repair turns out to be more complex, you should always be kept in the loop. We hope to resolve this issue very soon, and will be in touch. -Best, MyPhone Repair Team

name: Harland Underhill
text:
Yesterday a friend sent me a link with a dire caveat that I'm probably not going to like this but I should see it. I open the link and lo and behold there is my wife, in all her glory, but with nothing else on. Now I've seen this picture before, she took it herself with my own personal phone. No where has this picture ever been shared, sent, or even seen by another soul other than myself. That is until I took my phone to get the battery taken care of at CH PC Repair.

Now I understand that this is partly my fault for leaving that picture on my phone, I accept that. I had honestly forgotten that it was on there. But I had incorrectly assumed that my personal data would remain personal while my phone was in Chad's possession, but apparently that isn't the case.

While the battery was fixed, I've now got to live with the fact that there are not so tasteful pictures of my wife out there for the world to see thanks to some perv PC repairman. If you for some reason desire to use this child for any repair work, make sure your data is extra secure or you wipe your memory card/hard drive before you take it to him. I'm over being mad at this, I'm just disgusted that there are people still like this out there in the world.

resp.text: Hello, Harland Underhill. I am having trouble reaching you.. I do not understand why you left such a review about me, and my business. I work extremely hard, and I take pride in my business. I would not do something of this matter. What would I benefit from this? nothing, nothing good at all. I am a man of integrity. I am known for the good work I do, and honestness.

name: Jason Williams
text:
This guy is awful.  No patience, no respect, no apologies when he screws up.  Everything is on his demands, but never his fault.  Respect is free, try giving it away sometime.

Don't believe his stories.  He complained in LESS than a week - regarding a shipment originating in Canada - which were the terms he agreed to when he purchased (and also mirrored by the eBay shipping expected time).  But mistakes happen - all I needed was for him to say 'Sorry, my mistake'...  But he couldn't do that - preferring to say that he would be leaving negative feedback (for something he was completely wrong about).  Fortunately I had not shipped the part yet, as I was going to be in the US shortly, and able to do a much quicker & more secure USPS shipment...  But once you threaten negative feedback over something that you're wrong about, and are repeatedly unable to understand that you're in the wrong - damn right I'm canceling that order.  I have the right to "fire" a customer who is not conducting themselves appropriately.

Most notable is the fact that negative feedback was left for me, and it took ~5 minutes for the eBay rep to review the details and get it taken down.  His complaints to eBay have resulted in absolutely zero effect on my account.  Clearly he was in the wrong in every part of this transaction, and he has YET to take responsibility or apologize for his errors.  I would not trust him to act in an appropriate manner in any facet of business, therefore this review is perfectly valid based on the lack of professionalism he has shown.

resp.text: I purchased an item from this guy on ebay(viridel75) Paid May, 3rd. I complained that it wasn't shipped May, 12th. He canceled the sale without me agreeing. Keeps blaming me for his mistakes. Knows nothing about respect!, Now harassing me?.. Reported to ebay.

name: Carla Hardin
text: Momma had a Samsung Galaxy s6 that just needed a new battery.  Ordered a battery from Amazon and they couldn't get the back of the phone off.  So they call the Verizon retail store in hazel green and the girl told her to take it to ch pc repair and he would do it.  My mothers phone worked FINE when she took it in there.  She could do anything and everything on her phone.  When she went to pick it up the phone would not even turn on.   He said he tried both old and new battery and it still wouldn't come on.  So he took the screen off and put it on another phone and the screen works.  So he is saying that the mother board is messed up.  He can check it out BUT he'd have to charge her to do it.  Momma said he really messed the back up,  like it was melted!!  I met her up there and his attitude is  basically "screw you ".  He insisted that the phone was not working when she took it in.  I asked him why he didn't call her and tell her and he said because she didnt leave a number.  To which my reply is "when you work in customer service like this it is your responsibility to get a number so you can get in touch with the person". He is a total jerk!!  He takes ZERO responsibility for his screw ups.  Said he was not going to make it right.  But he did tell her that he'd buy the phone from her when she bought a new one.  Then he threatened to call the cops on us "because it was after hours, he was closed and we wouldn't leave".  He never asked us to leave, period.  He brags about how much money he makes per year and all of his vehicles and house is paid for.  Good for him.  I dont give a 🐁but what he has and doesn't have.  And now Marina tells us that her stepfather took a phone to him that was kinda messed up and was going to get the guy to repair it.  When he went to pick the phone up or really was messed up!!!

resp.text:
Carla,

This issue is between me, and my client Pam Lanford. You came into my office, clearly disgruntled. You then continued to talk over me without giving me a chance to respond or explain the situation.

Pam visited my store with her device, which she believed to have a battery issue. She provided an aftermarket battery and had explained that an attempt was made, using a hairdryer, to open the casing and replace the battery, prior to me looking at the device. When the device was dropped off, I was in the middle of an extensive repair, as well as having a conversation with a different client. Not only that, but the device was dropped off quickly, without any contact information, and with very few details.

I replaced the battery with the after-market battery she provided and then attempted to boot up the device, but to no avail. I investigated further but was unable to find a solution. Pam then arrived to pick up her device, and she was, understandably, very upset to find it not working. She wanted it in working order right then and there, and while I understand her sentiments, I can only do so much so quickly. I needed more time to troubleshoot and determine the problem and possible solution, but she would not allow it. I was even willing to reimburse her with a fair value for her device.

I have been in business for more than 10 years now. I work hard every day, and I like to think that I am very good at what I do. I manage hundreds of computers monthly, and I repair and fix many devices daily (thousands of devices yearly). I can remove a device's back/screen in a few minutes with simply a bit of heat and some playing cards, and I have never had any issues. I would never damage a device intentionally. I treat all repairs as if they were my own. That being said, mistakes can (and do) happen as there are many risks involved with these repairs, but I do my best to make things right. To me, it's not just about collecting payment for the services I provide—although that is necessary for me to stay in business and provide for my family. It's about building long-term relationships with my clients, and I deeply enjoy helping and providing knowledge to my clients.

This is the first complaint I have received with the BBB, and I would truly like to resolve the issue, and have the opportunity to change your outlook on me and your experience with my business. CH PC Repair is my business—it has my name in it, a fact that I am proud of and would never change.

Sincerely,
Chad Harbin
CH PC Repair

resp.text: This customer's phone was quite unusual in that no model number could be found anywhere on the device even when we took the phone apart; there was no model number listed. We ordered a charging port for a similar model but unfortunately it would not work on this customer's device. We tried to explain the problem to our customer. Much time was spent on this phone in trying to find the model number. It's just very unusual for such a device not to have one listed anywhere on the phone. We waived the $40 fee that we could have charged the customer for our efforts. The week delay the customer complained about was due to his electing free shipping instead of having the part expedited. We informed the customer at the start that it would take anywhere from a week or more for a part to arrive if he chose the free shipping option and did not want to pay for it to be expedited. We are sorry to disappoint the customer but we did fully explain to him the time it would take to get the part and that it might not work since we could not find a model number on his device.

We actually do not advertise that we buy any and everything. However though we do say we buy most electronics (depending on the type and condition). We have never advertise in any form that we buy any electronics even if they are really old and broken like your phone that was brought into the store. I spoke with the rep. that assisted you that day and you brought in a Galaxy S3 Sprint broken that is really old and cost more then what we sell them for used. You also brought a Dell tablet that the screen was broken and would cost a lot to fix it and giving its age as well it would not be cost effective to repair and resale.

We are sorry you feel this way but as a business owner you would not buy something that you would spend more on fixing it then what you would sale it for. We are sorry you though we bought any and everything but we have never said that or advertised it.

Thanks,
Nate B. Brewer

While they didn’t replace it for free, they showed me how it couldn’t have just broke and the Apple guy probably broke it and didn’t own up to it, they helped me replace the screen and I am forever satisfied with this business again.
They are good people with hearts of gold. And they put up with a lot. And I meant ALOT. So next time you need a phone repair, laptop repair, or even computer, go see these guys at Phone Probs. They will do everything they can to help you be satisfied and keep coming back.
I went from having an iPhone so badly bent and cracked that you couldn’t even use it right to one that looks dang near new! Thank you Phone Probs!

resp.text:
We are sorry to hear this and we strive to do quality work. Although we put a manufacturer warranty on all repairs it does not cover however customer caused damage. You had cracked it so we could not offer to replace it free of charge. We did however offer you a discount due to the inconvenience on your behalf but you did not accept our offer.

We are sorry you broke your phone we understand we break our own too. It happens but we do not cover customer cased damage unfortunately. We do however offer a warranty on accidental breakage but I'm not sure if it was available at the time you got your phone fixed and for this we could offer you that warranty. Please call us and we will be happy to offer the accidental breakage warranty.

Thanks,
Team PhoneProbs

text: Do not bring anything to Frankie for repair. I hired him to repair the circuit board in my welder. Paid him for the job, which only half of it was done. Asked him to replace all of the capacitors on the board. He did not. He left a diode that he had cut loose. The soldering was the worst looking hack jobs I have ever seen. He picked up the board and was paid $90 initially to check it on the machine. I had to drive to Dothan to retrieve it from him and paid the balance of $145. Installed the board and the welder has no output at all now. Originally agreed upon price was $220. When I got the board back the diode was never reconnected, the solder joints were ridiculously poor. And the welder still does not work. He came out and wanted another $25 to “check” the board again. He came and “checked” the board again. He said there is another bad part on the board. How could there be another bad part if he checked the whole board. So after seeing the poor workmanship displayed. I asked for a partial refund. He said no. So now I am out $235 and my welder still doesn’t work. If I had only known that he couldn’t do the job to start with, I would never have hired him to do it. This guy does not know what he is doing! Please save your hard earned money. Seek out a professional. Don’t get screwed like I did!

name: rob merritt
text: Frankie is a hack and a tool at best. He is not a man of his word. He thrives on only doing part of the job, so that you call him for extra costly service calls. Also not impressed with his Harbor Freight soldering gun (which he isn't very proficient with) . His guarantees are worthless. POS

name: stephanie phillips
text: Did a great job on the repair you did on our juke box.. thanks again

name: Cynondria
text:
He never showed up. I called Frankie at 10 am to get my tv fixed. We set up an appointment at 4 the same day. I drove from Daleville with a 60 inch tv (very heavy to lug down a flight of stairs during a storm) to get it fixed. When we got there it was a little past 4 so I called him on his phone. He said he was on a service call and to wait for him til 5. Okay sure. So we drove around for a bit before coming back at 5. We tried calling but he wouldn’t answer pick up.we waited out there til 6:25 and tried calling a few more times before giving up. If you run a Business and set up an appointment please be professional about it. Because not only did you waste my time but you wasted my gas and that’s money. :/ the least that could have been done was to set up an appointment for another day or at least tell us you were too busy or something. Ignoring customers is not the answer.

Edit 1/3: he messaged us to repair our tv a few days after the above incident. We let him take it. He stole our tv and closed his business. What a scam. I will be coming over to the business to claim the television set we left there

name: Willie Thornton
text: He's a good guy when it comes to help on ur electronic

name: Keith Hudson
text: Great repair work on a 25 year old Only FM receiver. Thanks!

name: Mark Given
text: Frankie repaired my old 70’s Marantz receiver back to new. Great work, quick turnaround and all at a fair price.

name: Layna Cook
text: Awesome service . fast and friendly!! Highly recommend!!!

name: Andy Midkiff
text: My charger port pins got damaged and brought to Elite; they did there best to try and fix. Said they could send off but shot me straight saying probably not worth the expense. Gave me good advice to pull battery out and charge in another phone so I could get my data transferred. Good people.

resp.text: Thank you Andy! You’re review is greatly appreciated!

name: Henry and Lucy Sowell
text: Shattered my screen.  Took my phone in.  Kristian had to order the parts.  As soon as the part came in he called and I took my phone in.  It was 1p.m. Christmas Eve.  Kristian said he would do his best to get my phone to me as soon as possible.  Received a call around 8 p.m.  Kristian delivered my phone to my home at 8:30 p.m.  Very knowledgeable and very customer oriented.  Would highly recommend Kristina for any cell phone service.

name: Eva Klemann
text: Elite Cell Phone Shop was easy to find on Bancroft St. They repaired my phone quickly and was very courteous. I would definitely recommend and use again.

name: christopher barnes
text: Excellent service... was thorough and professional

resp.text: Thanks Christopher!

name: Hunter Bokus
text:
Wonderful fellow owns the place. Very efficient, and extremely helpful. Definitely a good idea to go here before going to your carrier.  He saved me money, and put my mind at ease.

Thanks so much!

name: the-sad-guru
text: GREAT SERVICE!! Had a ruined iPhone 5 screen that they replaced, with no appointment, in under 30 minutes. And installed a glass screen protector (which was installed straight, not crooked like every other shop has done me) and a new case - both of which were discounted because I was having my phone serviced. These kids are cute, competent, and quick. Across from Fairhope Post Office.

name: Shelby
text: I shattered my phone screen on a Saturday afternoon and needed it fixed quickly. I immediately called this shop and Kristian was very helpful over the phone with precise information. I dropped it off and thirty minutes later, I had a nice new screen. Pleasure doing business with this company! Will return for all cell phone repair needs. Not to mention the shop has a very relaxing, no pressure environment. Absolutely recommend!

text: Super friendly and great comprehensive service. Repairs done quickly and was able to pick up 2 phones being fixed within an hour. Highly recommend.
